chunks.original_text: 神山无为应缘长生子刘处玄造 五吉闷绝句颂一百六十一首 念道觉真安，命清胜炼丹。 通天全至行，跳出死生关。 昨日似陈团，今朝忧又欢。 灵虚斋敬礼，知观谢尊官。 无争祸不侵，有道圣贤钦。 积行生生贵，福真莫外寻。 禅通明释藏，禅定真无相。 禅慧口难言，禅天无缺朗。 无事不贪求，无争不辨休。 无言只念道，无喜亦无忧。 一别又经秋，去都过保州。 尊官为念道，宽转近西游。 垢尽宝光明，碧天万里青。 真平全至行，应变悟仙经。 辅国置仙庵，舍资道福贪。 辩能明万有，会得却如憨。 积行妙通天，心真泯万愆。 古今明了者，命住宝光圆。 大道本无修，随缘弗外求。 始终无变异，归去列仙俦。 食荤勿杀生，治政似冰清。 无事看庄老，通天至行成。 无灶免煎熬，火坑几个逃。 清凉福地别，饥后吃蟠桃。 希夷为道母，赤子是真儿。 相见超生灭，升仙行就时。 真平至行全，保命体延年。 三教明真理，未仙也是贤。 看地见飞星，没中圣位灵，两厢盖草舍，松桧四边青。 桥就更修道，无事看圣教。 功行两双全，了了无生老。 临水望思山，逍遥出世间。 这些幽雅景，不让古长安。 长通四相忘，顿觉免无常。 得道离生灭，蓬莱去莫忙。 莫爱也休憎，真常神气灵。 命清癸耀灿，达理自然升。 草舍近河山，清居厌世间，昼闲看道德，夜静听潺湲。 庵傍近会稽，远却世尘非。 道觉真灵莹，澄光万耀辉。 西南近黄白，石窟真仙宅。 隐道伴松筠，他年蓬岛客。 福地靠三阳，山前是道乡。 龙华同一会，旦望预行香。 山耸应天门，清真酬四恩。 有人来问道，应对敬其尊。 幽居近北山，无意想尘寰。 助道田三段，养真麻麦餐。 临水蹬山青，碧天万里平。 顿明全道德，归去大罗行。 前后有青山，甲庚明二关。 一真颠倒妙，空外白云闲。 上善应清清，行通似水平。 天青悬万象，性板命光成。 甲地妙通清，真明道象灵，夷然全至行，归去碧霄行。 举意掩他非，希夷泯见知。 应机明万慧，无着亦无离。 茅舍喜清居。 闲看三教书。 自然明妙理，世外乐无余。 乱作寄汾阳，愿人效马王。 混尘真世外，蜕壳到仙乡。 祈雨各逐村，众善天垂恩。 莫杀生灵福，香灯茶果存。 顿觉悟金刚，真明四相忘。 无形性不老，认得免无常。 敬信辨真斋，清通兔去来。 始终心不变，蜕壳到蓬莱。 常开方便门，出入敬真尊。 日日酬三孝，时时报四恩。 前厅对后堂，冬夏取炎凉。 清善崇三教，人间世梦忘。 顺尊至孝全，意静胜参禅。 四相真忘尽，顿明佛是仙。 恍惚发珠光，回光晃八方。 萤明难吐耀，天莹现真阳。 忘世意休争，心闲看道经。 了真无老死。 达理自然明。 真趣道眸开，善清无祸灾。 冲和全性命，蜕壳到蓬莱。 无恶气清深，忘情觉水金。 虚心真混合，抱道鬼神钦。 顿明世梦虚，趖业洞天居。 超彼灵峰畔，欣时看古书。 忘尘悟死生，大达意无争。 应变明真理，他年功行盈。 日用自然真，冲和气养神。 命清金耀结，归去了仙人。 出入应环墙，真通动静忘。 卦爻明坐卧，阴尽变纯阳。 意灭觉真生，微通道眼明。 无憎全至行，命住气神灵。 常似圣贤随，自然意泯痴。 蛾灯闻早悟，真了碧霄归。 无欲似天青，自然万象明。 亘灵与道洽，应变语如经。
chunks.translated_text:
The Divine Mountain’s Effortless Response to Conditions: *Changshengzi* Liu Chuxuan’s *Five Auspicious Obscurities* – 161 Quatrains and Hymns

Hymn to Awakening the Dao and Realizing Truth:
Life serene surpasses cinnabar’s glow,
Heaven-penetrating, the perfect act bestows—
Leaping free from death’s and life’s gate’s woe.

Yesterday’s sorrows like tangled thread,
This morn’s joy and care intertwine instead.
In reverent fast, bowing deep in grace,
I thank the honored master for his place.

No strife—calamity cannot draw near,
The Dao’s presence—sages hold it dear.
Virtuous deeds through lives bring noble worth,
True blessings need not seek the outer earth.

Chan’s clarity illumines the sutras’ store,
Chan’s stillness—truly formless evermore.
Chan’s wisdom—words can scarce convey,
Chan’s heaven—flawless, radiant as day.

No affairs—no craving’s endless chain,
No strife—no need for words to feign.
Silent, I chant the Dao alone,
No joy, no sorrow—heart full-grown.

One parting, autumn’s span has flown,
From the capital to Baozhou’s town.
The honored master, for the Dao’s sake,
Allows this westward journey I now make.

Filth cleansed—treasure’s light shines bright,
Azure sky—endless, vast in height.
True peace, the perfect act complete,
Responsive change—immortal scriptures meet.

To aid the realm, a Daoist hermitage is raised,
Resources offered—Dao’s blessings praised.
Discerning all existence’s boundless span,
Yet comprehending, one seems but a man.

Virtuous deeds—wondrous, heaven’s gate they ope,
Heart true—myriad transgressions elope.
From ancient times to now, the enlightened few,
Abide where treasure’s light shines ever true.

The Great Dao needs no cultivation’s art,
Following conditions—seek not far apart.
From start to end, no change, no shift,
Returning, one joins immortals’ gift.

Refrain from flesh, let no life be slain,
Govern with clarity like ice’s sheen.
No affairs—read Zhuangzi and Laozi’s lore,
Heaven-penetrating acts—perfected more.

No hearth—no searing torment’s blight,
How few escape the fire-pit’s plight!
A cool, blessed land apart,
Hungry, feast on peaches’ art.

Stillness and Non-being—Dao’s mother,
The innocent child—truth’s own brother.
Meeting thus, transcend life and death,
Ascending immortal—time is set.

True peace, perfect act complete,
Preserving life—years extend replete.
The Three Teachings clarify truth’s core,
Not yet immortal—still a sage of yore.

Gazing earthward, stars take flight,
In their absence—saints’ spirits bright.
Grass-thatched huts on either side,
Pines and cypress—verdant pride.

Bridges built, the Dao refine,
No affairs—study scriptures divine.
Merit and practice—both complete,
Fully realized—no aging, no deceit.

By waterside, gazing at Thoughtful Peak,
Carefree, beyond the world I seek.
Such secluded, elegant scenes unfold,
Not yielding to ancient Chang’an of old.

The Four Forms forgotten in one stroke,
Sudden awakening—no impermanence invoked.
The Dao attained, life and death left behind,
To Penglai’s isle—no need to rush, unwind.

No love, no hate—let passions cease,
True constancy—spirit’s light increase.
Life serene—*gui*’s radiance gleams,
Comprehending principle—naturally one ascends.

Grass-thatched hut by rivers and hills,
Pure abode—world’s dust distills.
Days at leisure—studying *Dao* and *Virtue*,
Nights in stillness—brook’s murmur I follow.

Hermitage near Kuaiji’s height,
Far from worldly dust’s blight.
Dao’s awakening—true spirit’s sheen,
Limpid light—myriad glows convene.

Southwest, near yellow and white’s domain,
Stone grotto—true immortals’ reign.
Hidden with Dao, pine and bamboo’s kin,
One day, Penglai’s isle to welcome in.

Blessed land beside Three Yangs’ glow,
Before the mountain—Dao’s homeland below.
Dragon Flower’s gathering—one accord,
Dawn and full moon—incense’s reward.

Mountain soars like Heaven’s Gate,
Pure and true—four debts to abate.
Should one come seeking the Dao’s way,
Respond with reverence, honor they sway.

Secluded dwelling near northern peak,
No worldly thoughts the heart to seek.
Three plots of land to aid the Dao,
Nourishing truth—hemp and wheat’s fare bestow.

By waterside, climbing verdant height,
Azure sky—endless, vast in sight.
Suddenly enlightened—Dao and *Virtue* whole,
Returning to Great Purity’s scroll.

Green mountains front and rear,
*Jia* and *Geng*—two passes clear.
One truth’s wondrous, inverted art,
Beyond the void—white clouds impart.

Supreme goodness—pure as can be,
Conduct flows like water’s spree.
Heaven’s blue—myriad forms suspended,
Nature’s board—life’s light transcended.

*Jia*’s earth—wondrous, pure, and bright,
True clarity—Dao’s image light.
Serene, the perfect act complete,
Returning—azure heavens’ seat.

Intent to conceal others’ flaws,
Stillness and Non-being—all knowledge withdraws.
Responsive to the moment—myriad wisdoms shine,
No attachment, no separation—all is fine.

Thatched hut delights in pure abode,
Leisurely perusing Three Teachings’ code.
Naturally, the wondrous principle is clear,
Beyond the world—joy without peer.

Chaos sent to Fenyang’s land,
May all emulate Ma and Wang’s stand.
Beyond the world’s dust—true reality,
Shedding the husk—to immortals’ city.

Praying for rain, each village’s plea,
Countless virtues—heaven’s grace decree.
Refrain from killing—blessings to bestow,
Incense, lamps, tea, and fruit to stow.

Suddenly awakened—*Vajra*’s might,
True clarity—Four Forms take flight.
Formless nature—ageless, free,
Recognizing this—no impermanence to see.

Reverent faith discerns true fast,
Pure and clear—no coming, no past.
From start to end, heart unwavering,
Shedding the husk—to Penglai’s spring.

Ever open the gate of convenience,
Enter and exit—honor truth’s presence.
Daily, repay the Three Bonds’ debt,
Timely, the Four Graces’ due is met.

Front hall faces the rear chamber’s space,
Winter and summer—warmth and coolness embrace.
Pure goodness—Three Teachings uphold,
In the world—dreams of dust grow cold.

Honoring parents—filial piety complete,
Mind still—surpasses Chan’s seat.
Four Forms truly forgotten all,
Suddenly enlightened—Buddha is immortal.

Dimly, pearl’s light begins to gleam,
Turning inward—eight directions beam.
Firefly’s glow—hard to express,
Heaven’s clarity—true Yang’s impress.

Forget the world—intent no strife,
Mind at leisure—Dao’s scripture rife.
Realized truth—no aging, no death,
Comprehending principle—naturally clear breath.

True delight—Dao’s gaze unfolds,
Goodness pure—no calamity beholds.
Harmonious and balanced—nature and life,
Shedding the husk—to Penglai’s isle in flight.

No evil—*qi* deep and clear,
Forgetting emotions—water and gold appear.
Empty heart—true unity’s embrace,
Embracing the Dao—ghosts and spirits grace.

Suddenly enlightened—world’s dream is vain,
Escaping karma—to grotto-heaven’s domain.
Beyond that numinous peak’s side,
Joyful, perusing ancient texts abide.

Forgetting dust—life and death’s grasp,
Great comprehension—no strife’s clasp.
Responsive change—true principle bright,
In time, merit and practice take flight.

Daily use—naturally true,
Harmonious *qi*—nurtures spirit’s hue.
Life serene—gold’s radiance knits,
Returning—immortal’s path permits.

Entering and exiting—enclosing wall,
True clarity—forgets movement and stall.
Hexagrams and lines—sitting, lying known,
Yin exhausted—pure Yang is grown.

Intent extinguished—true awakening’s birth,
Subtle clarity—Dao’s eye sees earth.
No hatred—perfect act complete,
Life abides—spirit’s light replete.

Ever following sages’ trace,
Naturally—delusion’s dust erase.
Moth to flame—early awakening’s call,
True realization—azure heavens’ hall.

No desire—like heaven’s blue,
Naturally—myriad forms shine through.
Spirit and Dao—eternally aligned,
Responsive change—words like scriptures shined.

chunks.original_text: 真悟松间鹤，伪迷蛾恋灯。 浊清明两路，就死入油烹。 早早悟骷髅，命清兔九幽。 金婴调玉姹，真莹上云头。 清柔神气灵，尽爱命光成。 达理通天道，真升云路行。 无物道无传，真通结汞铅。 要归蓬岛去，功行积三千。 造化隐丹经，天青万象明。 真光非意想，颠倒甲通庚。 冬凛采黄芽，夏炎收白雪。 金婴出玉峰，到此离生灭。 善清修性命，泯虑除罪病。 道德自然通，他年朝至圣。 日用善清通，气神相见功，忘情全命耀，真去与仙同。 物似镜中形，光通万象明。 应尘无挂碍，觉了行功成。 顿明生死大，常善居尘外。 巨海变桑田，亘灵与道在。 念道命光圆，无形性达全，自然通上善，蜕壳是真仙。 明道泯争爱，真通性命大。 坚志免轮回，石烂神光在。 目前万事假，莫纵猿儿傻。 乐道喜松峰，趖伪真脱洒。 身老真无老，修行无忒早。 命延道德全，也得归蓬岛。 无我神气清，忘欲癸光停。 觉了希夷妙，自然大道成。 世梦转头空，忘尘见亘容。 仙乡真景异，云路仗修功。 轮回几万遭，达理死生逃。 养就真铅汞，珠光钓巨鳌。 真通泯世机，顿解死生危。 道乐松峰下，冲和结坎离。 浊恶变清善，轮回生灭免。 命全光不缺，真了碧霄现。 到岸了无生，灵峰云外行。 乐真隐霞洞，应景对清平。 道善悟无争，炼真降火生。 癸光全法体，蜕壳自然升。 念色想骷髅，真沉堕九幽。 无生全道妙，命住访瀛洲。 喜怒寸俱忘，真通性有常。 气和全命耀，蜕壳到仙乡。 日用自然真，冲和气养神。 意清全癸耀，阴尽碧霄人。 损有了真无，孤云在碧虚。 往来何挂碍，全道是功夫。 真明通理趣，垢尽心开悟。 抱道乐清贫，自然达万古。 贩骨几千遭，无生一念逃。 自然通万慧，保命运阳爻。 上士悟无争，冲和道眼明。 真通全万行，觉了自然升。 至死常清静，忘情完性命。 超升免下鬼，大罗朝贤圣。 念通明道理，真了无忧喜，阳降气神灵，孤峰觉岸彼。 缚住傻猿用，真明应不动。 清通全道德，灵隐华阳洞。 善和道性通，非是听如聋。 掩恶全至道，明知万事空。 忘贪有甚争，无我觉真明。 照见亘初面，功成云路行。 清真保性命，爱尽心猿定。 无罪免沉沦，碧霄朝至圣。 从善悟死生，命清神气灵。 玉峰霞洞隐，应变妙通经。 明虚可奉真，降火变红银。 清志始终达，修成身外身。 细思生死大，到岸离苦海。 乐道免沉沦，隐真游世外。 日用缚心猿，触来灭黑烟。 真常成善果，归去号神仙。 明一是修行，寸灵常静清。 积行除憎爱，归去自然升。 月缺变光圆，命全是了仙。 意清通道妙，功行积三千。 书院隐青山，修真厌世间。 道免轮回苦，逍遥松下闲。 无情石变灰，妙理几人知。 这个真无坏，弗为应有为。 学道要真坚，触来莫发烟。 清通全上善，尽爱命光圆。 失道堕傍生，了真全命灵。 理明通古教，厌世洞天行。 蛾爱恋灯光，迷阴命怎常。 鹤思松悟觉，真去到仙乡。 坚志了无生，修真有甚争。 厌尘霞洞隐，保命悟仙经。 达理真超彼，古今通有几。 清平功行全，升入丹霄裹。 清通全性命，忘机泯罪病。 觉慧自然明，住行如对圣。 贩骨死生大，沉沦千万载。 了真得道阳，海变松枯在。 慧通明正理，得道真超彼。 天莹宝光圆，寒潭清彻底。

True awakening—crane among pines,
False delusion—moth to flame’s designs.
Turbid and clear—two paths unfold,
Clinging to death—boiled in oil’s hold.

Awaken early to the skull’s stark sight,
Life purified—rabbit escapes ninefold night.
Golden infant and jade maiden refine,
True radiance ascends to clouds’ high line.

Gentle and soft—spirit and *qi* bright,
All-loving—life’s light takes flight.
Comprehending principle—Dao’s sky-way known,
True ascent—cloud-paths are flown.

No-thing—Dao’s transmission none,
True communion—mercury and lead are one.
To return to Peng Isle’s shore,
Three thousand merits must restore.

Creation’s work—hidden in alchemical scroll,
Azure heavens—myriad forms unfold.
True light—beyond thought’s reach,
Inversion—jia through geng’s breach.

Winter’s chill—plucking yellow sprout,
Summer’s blaze—gathering white snow’s clout.
Golden infant emerges from jade peak,
Here—beyond birth and death’s mystique.

Virtue and power—nurture nature and life,
Extinguish cares—dispel sin and strife.
Morality—naturally flows,
In time—audience with sages bestows.

Daily practice—pure and clear,
*Qi* and spirit—meet, appear.
Detached—life’s radiance whole,
True departure—immortal’s role.

Things—like shapes in mirror’s glass,
Light illumines—myriad forms amass.
Responding to dust—no hindrance clings,
Awakened—merit’s work brings.

Sudden clarity—life and death’s vast span,
Ever good—dwelling beyond the world’s plan.
Vast seas to mulberry fields transform,
Eternal spirit—with Dao in form.

Mindful of Dao—life’s light complete,
Formless—nature’s wholeness replete.
Naturally—supreme goodness known,
Shedding shell—true immortal shown.

Illumining Dao—strife and love dispelled,
True communion—nature and life upheld.
Firm resolve—escapes rebirth’s wheel,
Stone crumbles—spirit’s light remains real.

Before the eyes—all things but vain,
Let not the monkey-mind feign.
Delighting in Dao—pine peaks’ embrace,
Shunning falsity—true freedom’s grace.

Body ages—true self knows no old,
Cultivation—never too soon enrolled.
Life extended—morality whole,
Peng Isle’s return—achieved as goal.

No-self—spirit and *qi* clear,
Desire forgotten—gui’s light appears.
Awakened—mysterious subtlety’s gate,
Naturally—Great Dao’s state.

World’s dream—turning head, empty space,
Dust forgotten—eternal face.
Immortal land—true scenes unfold,
Cloud-paths—merit’s work behold.

Rebirth—countless times endured,
Comprehending principle—death’s snare secured.
Nurtured—true lead and mercury,
Pearl’s light—hooks the giant turtle’s sea.

True communion—world’s mechanisms fade,
Sudden liberation—life and death’s blade.
Dao’s joy—beneath pine peaks,
Harmonious union—Kan and Li meet.

Turbid evil—transforms to pure good,
Rebirth’s cycle—no longer withstood.
Life complete—light unbroken,
True attainment—azure heavens open.

Reaching shore—no-birth attained,
Spirit peak—beyond clouds gained.
Delighting in truth—cave of rosy glow,
Responding to scenes—pure and serene show.

Dao’s goodness—awakens to no-strife,
Refining truth—fire’s life ignites.
Gui’s light—Dharma-body whole,
Shedding shell—naturally ascends the soul.

Mindful of form—skull’s image hold,
True sinking—ninefold darkness cold.
No-birth—Dao’s wondrous state,
Life abides—searching Peng’s isle’s gate.

Joy and anger—both forgot,
True communion—nature’s constancy wrought.
*Qi* harmonized—life’s radiance full,
Shedding shell—immortal land to pull.

Daily use—naturally true,
Harmonious *qi*—nurtures spirit’s hue.
Intent clear—gui’s light complete,
Yin exhausted—azure heavens’ seat.

Reducing having—true nothingness known,
Solitary cloud—azure void’s throne.
Coming and going—what hindrance clings?
Whole Dao—merit’s work brings.

True clarity—principle’s delight,
Stains gone—heart’s awakening bright.
Embracing Dao—joy in poverty’s state,
Naturally—through ages’ gate.

Trading bones—thousands of times,
No-birth—one thought escapes the chimes.
Naturally—myriad wisdoms flow,
Preserving life—yang lines bestow.

Superior person—awakens to no-strife,
Harmonious—Dao’s eye sees life.
True communion—myriad deeds whole,
Awakened—naturally ascends the soul.

Until death—ever pure and still,
Detached—nature and life fulfill.
Ascending—escapes lower ghosts,
Great Luo—sages’ court hosts.

Mindful—principle’s light clear,
True awakening—no sorrow or cheer.
Yang descends—*qi* and spirit bright,
Solitary peak—far shore in sight.

Binding the foolish monkey’s use,
True clarity—unmoved by hues.
Pure communion—morality whole,
Spirit hidden—Huayang’s cave’s role.

Goodness and Dao—nature’s flow,
Not deaf—yet silence’s glow.
Concealing faults—whole Dao’s way,
Knowing all things—empty as day.

Forgetting greed—what strife remains?
No-self—true clarity attains.
Illumining—eternal face,
Merit complete—cloud-path’s grace.

Preserving truth—nature and life,
Love exhausted—monkey-mind’s strife.
No sin—escapes sinking’s plight,
Azure heavens—sages’ light.

Following goodness—awakens to death and birth,
Life purified—spirit and *qi*’s worth.
Jade peak—rosy cave’s retreat,
Responding—wondrous scriptures meet.

Illumining emptiness—true offering made,
Descending fire—red silver’s trade.
Pure resolve—beginning to end,
Cultivated—body beyond body’s blend.

Pondering deeply—life and death’s vast span,
Reaching shore—suffering’s sea to ban.
Delighting in Dao—escapes sinking’s tide,
Hiding truth—beyond the world’s side.

Daily use—binding the monkey’s mind,
Touching dust—black smoke’s decline.
True constancy—good fruit’s yield,
Returning—named immortal’s field.

Illumining the One—cultivation’s way,
Inch of spirit—ever still and clear.
Accumulating deeds—strife and love dispel,
Returning—naturally ascends the shell.

Moon wanes—light becomes whole,
Life complete—immortal’s role.
Intent clear—Dao’s wondrous gate,
Three thousand merits—merit’s weight.

Academy hidden—green mountains’ keep,
Cultivating truth—world’s weariness deep.
Dao escapes—rebirth’s pain,
Carefree—beneath pines’ domain.

Heartless stone—turns to ash,
Subtle principle—how many grasp?
This truth—never decays,
Not for action—yet responds always.

Learning Dao—must be truly firm,
Touching dust—let no smoke confirm.
Pure communion—supreme goodness whole,
All-loving—life’s light to fulfill.

Losing Dao—falls to beastly state,
True awakening—life’s spirit great.
Principle clear—ancient teachings known,
Weary of world—cave heavens’ throne.

Moth loves—lamp’s fleeting glow,
Deluded yin—life’s constancy how?
Crane pines for—awakening’s flight,
True departure—immortal land’s height.

Firm resolve—no-birth attained,
Cultivating truth—what strife remained?
Weary of dust—rosy cave’s retreat,
Preserving life—immortal scriptures meet.

Comprehending principle—truly beyond compare,
Ancient and modern—how few are there?
Pure and serene—merit complete,
Ascending—cinnabar clouds’ seat.

Pure communion—nature and life,
Forgetting mechanisms—sin and strife.
Awakened wisdom—naturally bright,
Abiding and moving—before sages’ sight.

Trading bones—life and death’s vast span,
Sinking—thousands of years’ plan.
True awakening—yang’s Dao attained,
Seas to mulberry—pines’ roots remained.

Wisdom illumines—right principle’s light,
Attaining Dao—truly beyond sight.
Heaven’s radiance—jewel’s light whole,
Cold pool—clear to the depths’ soul.

---

chunks.original_text: 日用去贪嗔，真通得道因。 微明神气结，命外更无亲。 泯我无灾祸，知空都打过。 志坚得道阳，应物全因果。 虚心念正通，应变理无穷。 达了明无上，汞铅交结功。 他非似己过，自是无争我，掩恶扬人美，德全成道果。 降耀觉冲明，自然亘貌灵。 尘尘真不染，造化甲通庚。 轮回生灭大，厌世游天外。 坚志乐清平，松枯性命在。 真通和气清，天莹宝光明。 妙觉真颠倒，自然铅汞成。 万通归无事，念道超生死。 应变合真经，自然明奥旨。 至善真无恶，世空意莫着。 清平全道德，了了蓬莱约。 妄灭慧光生，善清道性灵。 微通全命耀，达理行功成。 心忘道体存，存三酬四恩。 他年功了了，亘容朝世尊。 明道性真常，贪嗔浊念忘。 清通三宝结，蜕壳到仙乡。 清一要真坚，尽贪灭旧愆。 洞天修性命，功行积三千。 忘爱命光圆，意清似碧天。 真明全道理，归去步云轩。 失道近傍生，了真云路行。 命清免贩骨，达理自然升。 真常意似初，世伪悟知虚。 认得无形貌，道通运黍珠。 性光命似油，灵焰照无休。 顿觉超生灭，清欢天外游。 明焰悟三元，无亏宝鉴圆。 古今几个晓，觉了便通仙。 悟道无人我，光通运降火。 自然圆耀明，无上应仙果。 奉真清志坚，无物觉先天。 汞明全二八，未仙混世贤。 明道掩他非，无憎贤圣知。 德全通上善，真去步云归。 道用绝贪嗔，冲和气养神。 命清三宝结，蜕壳现真身。 正理自然通，中边不殢功。 慧明铅汞结，真去与仙同。 日用要擒猿，真如对圣贤。 清通铅汞结，功行了三千。 念道明真用，松峰隐碧洞。 清平积行功，性达结铅汞。 柔弱悟真火，无物通真我。 顿觉了真修，应有成真果。 性光命似油，早早悟骷髅。 情尽圆无缺，碧霄月正秋。 爱道却憎贪，真通身内三。 冲和全法体，达了蜕行庵。 日用运灵珠，宝光晃碧虚。 顿然真觉了，三界外无拘。 无生万业消，清静性逍遥。 妙用明真理，命圆喜寂寥。 明一静清常，通微动静忘。 德明真应物，道慧运天光。 冲和道性宁，清命渐通灵。 达理忘机了，蓬莱云路行。 灭恶通真善，慧眼开时见。 三宝全修炼，得道轮回免。 大悟不争空，忘形见亘容。 理明全至行，蜕壳住仙宫。 厌世居岳顶，抱一通壬丙。 乐道悟希夷，仙乡四序景。 抱真悟死生，天莹万光明。 挂碍心无了，白云空外行。 退志堕傍生，进真道气灵。 清通全癸耀，平善行功成。 觉了自然常，通微阳养阳，虚无包万化，至德隐佳祥。 日用理通真，道全物外因。 他年功行了，朝圣去携云。 人我障真修，趖冤福地游。 松筠常作伴，真了访瀛洲。 顿明通正理，今古人间几。 至德妙清平，灵峰道岸彼。 真觉道眸开，白云去又来。 碧空常自在，鹤引到蓬莱。 大道本无名，地天归静清。 阒通明万化，达理行功成。 丘刘谭马敬，忘形修性命。 清志有始终，寸尽万愆病。 丘刘谭马善，降火明修炼。 结就汞和铅，劝人依教典。 丘刘谭马悟，别有祖师度。 忘世洞天游，云霞为伴侣。 丘刘谭马觉，了道蜕凡壳。 升入太无中，亘灵居杳邈。 了真出死生，应变自然平。 理洽天心正，云归朝上清。 卦尽命光休，忘情好悟修。 孤云野鹤伴，真了到瀛洲。 人我障冲和，善清功行多。 命圆全道体，归去出娑婆。

chunks.original_text: 迷阴沉下鬼，抱道真超彼。 清静姹婴欢，乐安通炼己。 悟道超生死，真通明奥旨。 自然微妙深，行就朝元始。 应变道枢机，冲和觉妙微。 真了光无缺，碧空万道辉。 性命在无中，真空空不空。 自然包万化，今古几人通。 天元道善时，清志超生死。 达理爱憎无，炼真明奥旨。 妙清灵慧知，道解死生危。 依得金刚偈，通真霄汉梯。 觉照见天光，神清道有常。 应尘明万慧，真去礼丹阳。 业尽无烟火，谦柔弗竞我。 气神相见灵，道证无为果。 明道通真用，形忙心不动。 垂光照亘灵，结就真阳永。 常搜自己非，达理掩他非。 道德真经悟，不言闲是非。 觉了性无争，真清似水平。 德通全上善，自是行功盈。 颂曰 顺真则生，违道者死。 顺真则平，违道者浊。 顺真则柔，违道者刚。 顺真则福，违道者祸。 顺真则安，违道者病。 顺真则升，违道者堕。 顺真则炼铅，违道者丧命。 顺真则神灵，违道者气逆。 魂魄散为鬼，阴阳聚成仙。 身心静者为功，应变夷者为行。 志始终则达，觉清善则通。 居山财莫着於阒，混尘则休生於动。 或隐洞天，或游京华。 性似孤云，形如野鹤。 自然之道，微光有作。 住行坐卧，万物无愆。 蜕壳真归，出离三界。 永免轮回，无来无去。 三字歌 汾阳解，易象明，通天外。 汾阳解，五千明，不言拜。 汾阳解，金刚明，真佛坏。 汾阳解，万物尽，惟道在。 份阳解，混世华，无挂碍。 汾阳解，性命存，超三界。 汾阳解，达希夷，知没赛。 汾阳解，古今明，悟法海。 汾阳解，近松筠，逍遥快。 汾阳懈，无价珍，钱难买。 汾阳解，乐清虚，常宁耐。 汾阳解，了真修，结雯盖。 自然解，世人住，我不爱。 十二劝 有信人从，有真归奉。
chunks.translated_text:
Those lost in darkness descend as ghosts,
Embracing the Dao—truly transcend them.
In purity and stillness, the Infant and Maiden rejoice,
In joy and peace—refining the self is achieved.

Awakening to the Dao—transcends life and death,
True comprehension—illuminates profound mysteries.
Naturally subtle and wondrously deep,
Practice perfects—ascending to the Origin.

Adapting to change—grasps the Dao’s pivot,
In perfect harmony—awakens to marvelous subtleties.
Truly enlightened—light knows no lack,
Azure skies—myriad rays shine forth.

Nature and life reside in the formless,
True emptiness—empty yet not void.
Naturally embracing the ten thousand transformations,
From ancient times to now—how many have grasped this?

In the celestial cycle of the Dao—when virtue flourishes,
Pure aspiration—transcends life and death.
Understanding principle—love and aversion dissolve,
Refining the true—illuminates profound mysteries.

Marvelously pure—spiritual wisdom knows,
The Dao resolves—life and death’s peril.
Abiding by the Diamond Sutra’s verses,
One ascends the ladder—piercing heaven’s heights.

Awareness illuminates—heaven’s radiance,
Spirit clear—the Dao endures.
Responding to the world—ten thousand wisdoms shine,
Truly departing—pay homage to Danyang.

Karmic deeds exhausted—no smoke nor fire,
Humble and gentle—never contend.
Qi and spirit—meet in numinous union,
The Dao verifies—the fruit of non-action.

Illuminating the Dao—applies true function,
Form may rush—yet the heart remains unmoved.
Radiant light—illumines eternal spirit,
Congealing true yang—forever.

Constantly examine one’s own faults,
Understanding principle—covers others’ wrongs.
Comprehending the *Dao and Its Virtue*—awakens,
No idle words—on right or wrong.

Awakened—nature knows no strife,
Truly pure—like still water.
Virtue flows—perfecting supreme goodness,
Naturally—meritorious deeds overflow.

**Eulogy:**
Following the true—one lives,
Defying the Dao—one dies.
Following the true—one is at peace,
Defying the Dao—one is turbid.
Following the true—one is yielding,
Defying the Dao—one is rigid.
Following the true—one gains fortune,
Defying the Dao—one meets misfortune.
Following the true—one is at ease,
Defying the Dao—one falls ill.
Following the true—one ascends,
Defying the Dao—one descends.
Following the true—one refines lead,
Defying the Dao—one forfeits life.
Following the true—spirit is numinous,
Defying the Dao—qi rebels.
Soul and spirit scatter—becoming ghosts,
Yin and yang unite—becoming immortals.

Stillness of body and mind—is merit,
Adapting to change with equanimity—is conduct.
Resolute from beginning to end—one attains,
Awakened and pure in goodness—one penetrates.
Dwelling in mountains—let wealth not cling in solitude,
Mingling in the world—restrain from reckless action.
Some seclude in cave heavens,
Some wander the imperial capital.
Nature like solitary clouds,
Form like wild cranes.
The Dao of nature—subtle light manifests.
In dwelling, walking, sitting, lying—
The ten thousand things—no fault.
Shedding the husk—truly returning,
Departing the Three Realms.
Forever freed from the wheel of rebirth,
No coming, no going.

**Three-Character Song:**
Fenyang’s understanding—
The *Yi*’s images illuminate, reaching beyond heaven.
Fenyang’s understanding—
The *Five Thousand* shine, no need for bowing.
Fenyang’s understanding—
The Diamond’s clarity—true Buddha crumbles.
Fenyang’s understanding—
The ten thousand things perish, only the Dao remains.
Fenyang’s understanding—
Amid worldly splendor—no entanglements.
Fenyang’s understanding—
Nature and life endure, transcending the Three Realms.
Fenyang’s understanding—
Attaining the subtle and tranquil, knowing no peer.
Fenyang’s understanding—
Ancient and modern—awakened to the Dharma sea.
Fenyang’s understanding—
Near pine and bamboo—carefree and joyous.
Fenyang’s laxity—
Priceless treasure, money cannot buy.
Fenyang’s understanding—
Delighting in pure emptiness, ever patient.
Fenyang’s understanding—
Comprehending true cultivation, congealing the cloud canopy.
Naturally understanding—
The world’s dwellings—I do not cherish.

**Twelve Exhortations:**
Those with faith—follow,
Those with truth—devotedly revere.

chunks.original_text: 有谦德顺，有通理明。 有常无变，有定无乱。 有是忘非，常善无恶。 真爱无着，忘情无漏。 气清通微，全道神灵。 十劝 一劝不得自知是愆过慢人，纵意不改。 二劝不得自失错，嗔人道着，常起念怨人。 三劝不得自衒己是，直言常说他人非。 四劝不得夸自高，灭一切入道之人。 五劝不得不依经教说道理。 六劝不得有始无终，心意常要似初相见之时。 七劝不得常说他世人之短，只要常言世人之美处。 八劝不得作事不平等，不得见有施利者爱，见无施利者嫌。 九劝不得定慧者，修行之人不得不守静，未达理未开悟，不得不看书。 十劝不得执着有无，不得不悟住行坐外心常清静。 仙乐集卷之二竟 仙乐集卷之三
chunks.translated_text:
Those with humility and compliance,
Those with penetrating insight and clarity.
Abiding in constancy, never changing;
Established in stability, never chaotic.
Affirming what is right, forgetting what is wrong—
Ever virtuous, without evil.
True love without attachment,
Emotion forgotten, without leakage.
Qi refined, penetrating the subtle—
The fullness of the Dao, spirit numinous.

**Ten Exhortations:**
First: Do not persist in self-ignorance of faults and arrogance, indulging without reform.
Second: Do not err through self-loss, resenting those who point it out, harboring grudges.
Third: Do not boast of one’s own rightness, habitually speaking of others’ wrongs.
Fourth: Do not exalt oneself, belittling all who enter the Dao.
Fifth: Do not expound the Dao without relying on scripture and teaching.
Sixth: Do not begin without ending—let the heart ever remain as at first meeting.
Seventh: Do not habitually speak of others’ shortcomings; only ever praise their virtues.
Eighth: Do not act with partiality—do not favor those who offer benefit, nor disdain those who do not.
Ninth: For those cultivating samādhi and prajñā—do not fail to guard stillness; before attaining principle or awakening, do not cease studying scriptures.
Tenth: Do not cling to existence or nonexistence; do not fail to realize that in movement, stillness, sitting, and walking, the heart remains ever pure.

*Xianle Ji, Scroll Two—End*

chunks.translated_text:
**Four-Character Hymns by Liu Chuxuan of Wuying Immortal Mountain, Longshengzi—Expressing My Thoughts**

**I.**
Success achieved, body withdrawn,
Pure dwelling nurtures vastness.
By waters, near mountains,
Leisurely pondering Zhuang and Lao.
The land bears pines and bamboos,
Fine through all four seasons.
Deep within grotto-heavens,
Where one wishes to go, one arrives.
Cultivating truth brings wondrous proof,
Life abides, effects appear.
Old karma fades away,
New transgressions must not be made.
Truly revering the supreme Dao,
One inverts the world’s ways.
Returning like Yuanming,
First roaming Peng Isle.
Having slipped free, turning back,
The immortal realm knows no vexation.
Sages of past and present,
All penetrated the Three Teachings.

**II.**
Since time without beginning,
Countless ancestors have sunk in death.
As the Celestial Origin nears its end,
The *Yellow Register* saves from suffering.
Of thousands, one or two
Truly resolve to awaken.
With mind free of hatred or love,
The lofty immortals approve.
A human life spans a hundred years,
Yet only seeks the path of life.
Karma piles like mountains,
Hard to escape the nether courts.
The ten evils weigh heavily,
Condemning one to eternal suffering.
Yang deeds and yin practices—
How should one act?
Let all beings revere and believe,
Without harboring other concerns.
Worldly wealth is trifling,
Truth is the only speech.
To move heaven and earth,
One must dine purely and simply.
When approaching the altar for days,
Moving or staying in practice,
Unseen officials and spirits
Observe you day and night.
If found free of selfishness,
The Five Masters come to deliver you.
They memorialize the Celestial Sovereign,
Spreading vast blessings.
To behold the Three Luminaries again—
Such an opportunity after death is rare.

**III.**
A hundred thousand blessings aid,
A name transmitted through ten thousand ages.
The whole household, the entire family,
With minds like Pang and Xu.
Virtue and filial piety both perfected,
One becomes noble and prosperous.
Cultivating nature and life in advance,
Forever free from illness and suffering.
Departing the cycle of birth and death,
Neither coming nor going.
In the Great Luo’s immortal realm,
Attaining the Dao, one abides eternally.
Heavenly light and rosy clouds
Transform into a jeweled abode.
The six-zhu robe draped,
One ascends by different paths to the origin.
In the gardens of Lang and Peng,
The true immortals gather.
Once the Celestial Origin has passed,
The Dao’s karmic conditions are hard to meet.
The Three Teachings are undivided,
The gate of Quanzhen.
Nonaction responding to action,
Guiding people to awakening.
Pure and peaceful merit and conduct—
Truth is not to be grasped or discarded.
Beyond yin and yang,
The Primordial Ancestor.

**IV.**
When the appointed time arrives,
One must pay homage in reverence.

chunks.translated_text:
**IV. (continued)**

The heart’s exchange remains ever serene,
The mind’s imaginings free from strangeness.
In an instant, at the eastern gate,
We parted for two years.
Mountains and rivers unchanged,
Yet many people are no longer here.
Life is like dewdrops on a pearl—
How can it not decay?
Born in the Central Land,
Once one’s allotted span is spent, it cannot be regained.
An inch of the spirit’s Dao-treasure
Is worth ten thousand gold, yet priceless.
Unfulfilled greed and contention
All stem from love and attachment.
The four pursuits of fame and profit—
Everyone understands them.
Yet to comprehend virtue and the Dao,
Is to truly penetrate the Dharma-sea.
Auspicious mist and propitious qi
Weave into a canopy of clouds.
Strolling at ease on Pine Peak,
The spirit soars beyond the clouds.
Worldly falsity knows emptiness,
But birth and death are weighty matters.
In the secluded grotto-heavens,
Unfettered, one finds joy.
Revolving the harmonious qi,
Yin and yang unite in peace.
Having grasped the subtle and formless,
One truly ascends to the Yang realm.
Following the examples of Xu and Pang,
Free from debt or harm.

**V.**
A hundred years of human life—
Seventy is rare.
Worldly falsity knows emptiness,
Yet when will it ever end?
The Great Dao is natural,
Serene equanimity is supreme.
All things without flaw—
Better than performing grand rites.
The dream of past and present ages,
Suddenly awakens to true clarity.
Seeing through floating life,
All returns to a single smile.
Beyond the concerns of life and destiny,
One’s former attachments fade.

**VI.**
To serve as an official with integrity
Is truly free from guilt or illness.
Above, there are the Four Graces—
Accumulate merit and revere all.
Loyalty and filial piety govern the people,
Calm the mind and nurture nature.
Let the will not wander outward,
And the spirit will naturally settle.
Conceal evil and extol goodness—
Do not listen to idle words.
Abandon hatred and attachment,
Ever practicing impartiality.
Unattached to worldly splendor,
Wander idly along pine paths.
Green waters and blue mountains—
Grotto-heavens and immortal realms.
The original face,
Polished like a mirror.
Illuminating present and past,
Guard the Dao and reflect within.
When merit and conduct are complete,
One ascends to the Great Luo to pay homage.

**VII.**
Human life at seventy—
Rare in ancient and modern times.
Knowing the dream of the world is hollow,
All returns to a single smile.
In leisure, seek leisure—
To forget contrivance is to be done.
Ten thousand kinds of empty flowers,
In a turn of the head, vanish like illusion.
Truly honoring virtue and the Dao,
Gradually one penetrates the mysterious and wondrous.
Banish hatred and attachment—
Better than performing grand rites.
Within the body, life and destiny—
No small matter.
Like the sound of serene equanimity,
Even the Lord of Yin cannot summon it.

**VIII.**
From nonbeing, clarity arises,
Mysteriously penetrating divine incantations.
Jade-like nectar and ambrosia
Abide in the upper chambers.
When sober, one is pure and true—
Life extends, blessings and longevity follow.
The four lines of the Vajra,
In the sutras, offer compassionate deliverance.
The Dao of Heaven is hard to describe,
Formless yet imperishable.
Inverting yin and yang,
Mao ascends to meet You.
The subtle and formless are natural—
The Three Lights radiant and wondrous.
The immortal flowers of Lang Garden
Surpass the willows and blossoms of spring.
Revolving the Southern Asterism,
Wisdom gazes upon the Northern Dipper.
Greatly attaining nonaction,
One soars and roams at will.

**IX.**
Contemplating the true sutra in leisure
Surpasses empty words.
All things know emptiness—
Suddenly, there is no duality.
Revering the true without retreat,
One awakens as an immortal.
Pines and bamboo as neighbors,
Guard the Dao with a pure will.
From beginning to end, unwavering,
Heaven’s mechanism secretly bestows.
Wondrous enlightenment and true constancy—
All movement and stillness forgotten.
The primordial countenance,
Though visible, is hard to resemble.
Beyond yin and yang,
One departs the cycle of birth and death.

**X.**
Mother and child meet,
Naturally enlightened to the Dao.
With reverent faith and a true heart,
Take refuge in the Three Teachings.
Banish hatred and attachment,
Adapt to the profound and subtle.
Let the will dissolve greed and contention—
Free from guilt or affliction.
Life is like dewdrops on a pearl—
Cultivate the Dao early.
Recognizing the primordial spirit,
One never ages.
Suddenly perceiving a glimmer of light,
The cloud-path is reached.
Delighting in the Dao on Pine Peak,
Content with whatever comes.
Having conjoined mercury and lead,
Nurture the inner countenance.
When merit and conduct are both complete,
One truly ascends to Peng Isle.

**XI.**
A hundred strings of cash in the marketplace
Buy four trees.
Do not force others to seek,
Only aid in the work.
Unseen matters—
Few are real, many are false.
Willingly form affinities,
Reverence and faith are not lacking.
Among ten thousand, one may have
Surplus blessings and conduct.
At the immortal temples of Wu Palace,
The plaque reads "Spiritual Emptiness."
*(For the family of Cold-Seven Elder who left the household)*
When Cold-Seven Elder of the left-home life ascended,
His kin held a grand vegetarian feast and ritual,
Instructing the Daoists:
Do not demand payment for reciting scriptures.
If there is no money for recitation,
Only partake of the vegetarian meal.
The feathered robe is willingly offered—
The ritual is splendid to behold.
Profound virtue and great fortune
Conceal faults and earn praise.
For those who have not completed true cultivation,
How many demonic obstacles arise!
The sounds and sights before one’s eyes—
Principles reveal their illusory nature.
When mouth and heart align,
It is rare in the world.
Compassionately delivering sentient beings,
All transcend to the other shore.
The enlightened nature harmonious and serene,
Wood and metal converse.
Having refined the true form,
In a single surge, one ascends to the clouds.

**XII.**
While parents are alive,
How many truly understand?
People speak of long life,
Yet those who reach middle age are few.
From youth to old age,
There is awakening and delusion.
Fortune and misfortune—
Both follow one’s nature.
The body is like the waning moon,
Yet life remains whole.
Comprehending the Dao without delusion,
What doubt remains in true awakening?
When the spirit’s light shines forth,
One sees the ladder to the heavens.
Wisdom gazes upon the eight directions,
Letting go of east and west.
The Dao of Heaven is hard to describe,
Truly wondrous and subtle.
Having penetrated blessed conduct,
Even ghostly messengers cannot pursue.
The grotto-heaven is close at hand,
Lang Garden and Jasper Pool.
The natural treasure-sword
Ever guards against serpents and turtles.
Detached from all things,
One transcends the Three Realms.
Shedding the husk, truly departing,
Beyond emptiness, one returns to the clouds.

ends by different paths to the origin.
In the gardens of Lang and Peng,
The true immortals gather.
Once the Celestial Origin has passed,
The Dao’s karmic conditions are hard to meet.
The Three Teachings are undivided,
The gate of Quanzhen.
Nonaction responding to action,
Guiding people to awakening.
Pure and peaceful merit and conduct—
Truth is not to be grasped or discarded.
Beyond yin and yang,
The Primordial Ancestor.

**IV.**
When the appointed time arrives,
One must pay homage in reverence.

chunks.original_text: 名缰利锁，烧身猛火。 冤债恩情，业缘难躲。 积祸如山，怎成道果。 顿省性命，竞甚人我。 世为知空，般般可可。 相近六旬，万种识破。 儿孙更多，难替这个。 福来争要，灾病自卧。 古今生灭，前程会么。 虚空贤圣，怎生谩那。 新愆不造，阴公饶过。 日没之光，息虑休何。 实心敬信，哩唆哩啰。 波波劫劫，弗如闲坐。 从前失错，悔恨摧挫。 常行清善，胜施财货。 又 四面青城，似列围屏。 佛仙隐处，眼界宽明。 未能达道，闲看真经。 自然万慧，觉了无生。 无为至行，无爱无僧。 常清常净，气炼神灵。 古今悟者，依此超升。 闲非闲是，耳畔休听。 始终敬信，福德双成。 外如愚鲁，亘貌惺惺。 清虚忘世，意厌浮荣。 又 众生苦海，漂沉万载。 贩骨如山，恩极变害。 人世忙忙、几个悟解，石烂松枯，亘灵常在。 身似浮沤，未了冤债。 顿觉希夷，真忘欲爱。 命耀光圆，神升天外。 大道无形，古今弗坏。 积宝过斗，妙玄难买。 出却阳阴，一无挂碍。 二物冲和，自然交泰。 养就胎仙，净清没赛。 永免去来，逍遥真快。 水帘洞隐，飞泉千泒。 松峰乐道，真居阳界。 也无生老，亦无成败。 昔遇王马，中华曾拜。 他年蓬岛，相逢又再。 又 太上符箓，二十四阶。
chunks.translated_text:
Fame’s reins and profit’s shackles—
A raging fire consuming the body.
Karmic debts and bonds of gratitude,
The threads of karma cannot be evaded.
Piled misfortunes like mountains,
How can the fruit of the Dao be attained?
Suddenly awakening to one’s nature and life,
What then of self and others?
Seeing the world as empty,
All things become acceptable.
Nearing sixty years,
Ten thousand illusions are shattered.
Though children and grandchildren may multiply,
None can replace this one.
When fortune comes, all vie for it;
In calamity and sickness, one lies alone.
From ancient times to now, birth and extinction—
Does the future hold understanding?
Even sages and worthies in the void,
How can they be deceived?
With no new transgressions committed,
The lords of the unseen may grant pardon.
The fading light of sunset—
Cease thoughts, let go of cares.
With sincere heart, revere and trust,
*Lisuo liluo.*
Through endless kalpas,
Better to sit in stillness.
Past errors and faults,
Bring only remorse and regret.
To constantly practice pure goodness
Surpasses the giving of wealth.

Again—
Four-sided Green City,
Like screens arrayed in formation.
Where Buddhas and immortals conceal themselves,
The eye’s horizon is vast and bright.
Not yet having attained the Dao,
One idly peruses the true scriptures.
Naturally, all wisdom arises,
Awakening to the unborn.
The supreme practice of non-action,
Without attachment or aversion.
Ever pure, ever serene,
Qi refines the spirit.
Those who awakened in ancient and modern times
Ascended thus.
Idle chatter of right and wrong,
Let it pass unheard.
From beginning to end, revere and trust,
Virtue and fortune both come to fruition.
Outwardly appearing foolish,
Yet inwardly ever wakeful.
In clarity and emptiness, forgetting the world,
The mind wearies of fleeting glory.

Again—
The苦 sea of sentient beings,
Adrift for ten thousand kalpas.
Bones traded like mountains,
Kindness turned to harm.
In this bustling world,
How many awaken and understand?
Though rocks crumble and pines wither,
The true spirit remains eternal.
The body like a floating bubble,
Unresolved karmic debts linger.
Suddenly perceiving the subtle and serene,
Truly forgetting desire and attachment.
Life’s radiance shines round,
The spirit ascends beyond the heavens.
The Great Dao is formless,
Unchanging from ancient times to now.
Though treasures amass beyond measure,
The wondrous mystery cannot be bought.
Stepping beyond yin and yang,
Utterly free from entanglements.
The two forces in harmonious union,
Naturally bringing peace and prosperity.
Nurturing the embryonic immortal,
Pure and clear beyond compare.
Forever freed from coming and going,
In true bliss and carefree wandering.
Hidden in the Water Curtain Grotto,
A thousand cascades of flying springs.
Delighting in the Dao on Pine Peak,
The true abode in the yang realm.
Neither birth nor aging,
Nor success nor failure.
Long ago, meeting Wang and Ma,
In the Central Land, they once paid homage.
In future years on Penglai Isle,
We shall meet again.

Again—
The Supreme Registers of Talismans,
Twenty-four ranks.

chunks.original_text: 道藏要妙，宝坛常开。 天元传授，点化仙材。 真修性命，伪养形骸。 迷沉六道，悟去无来。 虚空贤圣，救世心哀。 清魂净魄，抱守仙胎。 理明万慧，至阒真斋。 时时微妙，斡运三台。 自然无作，平善无乖。 天心正法，不爱人财。 弗造诸愆，能消旧灾。 一顿通教，二气难埋。 三宝炼成，四位安排。 五行之外，六出咍咍。 七情阴尽，八卦明垓。 九天升入，十极蓬莱。 又 得到七十，更有一纪。 得尽天年，古今有几。 顿修性命，好事无比。 进真上仙，退道下鬼。 大达清通，无赞无毁。 不侵利害，真无忧喜。 闲看三教，微通至理。 出离苦海，神舟到彼。 累功积行，美之又美。 又 观今视古，几人肯悟。 休论出家，且如庞许。 生在中华，道德难遇。 父母之前，真本甚处。 认得希夷，倒颠乌兔。 妙达自然，清平仙举。 要修大药，何方好住。 洞天不远，携云闲去。 亘灵不老，幻躯有数。 命耀光圆，无来无去。 又 至道希夷，今古谁知。 阴阳之外，觉妙幽微。 道离空色，无为应为。 清真弗变，便是霄梯。 自然颠倒，运坎迎离。 忘情保命，皓月无亏。 白云来往，信任东西。 要调赤凤，真抱乌龟。 万伪识破，外似憨痴。 只扬人美，常搜己非。 顿忘憎爱，意没高低。 又 真仙术用，灵龟调凤。 把握阴阳，虚无妙用。 万景丛中，无静无动。 曾住京华，混世忘梦。 道德希夷，古今谁奉。 一颗神珠，自然拈弄。 都监同监，上呈拙颂。 道家清平，所虑辱宠。 大罗圣降，异香风送。 又 近醮人听，戒荤身静。 苦己无私，得些功行。 若犯天条，年灾月病。 应物忘尘，寸灵如镜。 吏神暗察，念念心正。 去憎尽爱，清通平等。 要免轮回，归依贤圣。 又 巨海谦低，万派清归。 至道无形，妙出毫眉。 涌泉智慧，得意忘知。 颐真保命，今古谁依。 寂寥无变，便是霄梯。 京华混世，独乐希夷。 自然达理，无悟无迷。 顿明三教，更有何疑。 藕在泥中，莲出青泥。 应化忘言，无为应为。 修行真俏，外貌如痴。 气神相见，结坎迎离。 世无肯省，却隐清溪。 周天十二，闲饮刀圭。 昔年云步，曾历关西。 恰似童稚，白发来催。 神仙未了，鬼使难追。 炼成魂魄，宝鉴无亏。 阴阳之外，乌兔常随。 任他人世，说是言非。 洞天不远，到者实稀。 万愆俱泯，永免轮回。 又 知空尘去，无争真悟。 念道清平，拂尽愁虑。 爱者不爱，高真见许。 觉性明常，寸无喜怒。 莫言非是，闲谈今古。 生在中华，早寻仙路。 忘情保命，清通子母。 〔赠道众〕
chunks.translated_text:
The Essential Wonders of the Daoist Canon,
The Sacred Altar ever open.
From the Primordial Heaven transmitted,
Transforming immortal talents.
True cultivation refines nature and life,
False nurturing merely sustains the body’s shell.
Lost, one sinks through the Six Paths;
Awakened, one departs without return.
Vacuous yet sagely,
Their compassion grieves for the world.
Purifying soul and spirit,
Embracing and guarding the immortal embryo.
Principles illuminate ten thousand wisdoms,
Attaining the profound purity of true fasting.
Moment by moment, subtly wondrous,
Revolving the Three Terraces.
Naturally without contrivance,
Serene and good, without discord.
The celestial heart’s true Dharma,
Neither covets wealth nor treasures.
Avoiding all transgressions,
It dissolves past calamities.
One sudden enlightenment unites all teachings,
The two qi cannot be buried.
The Three Treasures refined to perfection,
The Four Positions arranged in order.
Beyond the Five Phases,
The Six Exits resound with joy.
The seven emotions’ yin exhausted,
The Eight Trigrams shine to the farthest limits.
Ascending into the Nine Heavens,
The Ten Poles reach Penglai.
Moreover—
Attaining seventy years,
One more cycle remains.
Fulfilling heaven’s allotted span,
How few from ancient times to now?
Sudden cultivation of nature and life,
A matchless good deed.
Advancing, one becomes a true immortal;
Retreating, one descends as a ghost.
Greatly penetrating, clear, and unobstructed,
Beyond praise or blame.
Unassailed by profit or harm,
Truly free from sorrow or joy.
Leisurely observing the Three Teachings,
Subtly comprehending the utmost principle.
Escaping the sea of suffering,
The divine vessel arrives there.
Accumulating merit and deeds,
Ever more beautiful.
Moreover—
Gazing at present, looking to antiquity,
How many are willing to awaken?
Cease discussing leaving the household—
Consider Pang and Xu.
Born in the Central Land,
The Dao and virtue are rarely encountered.
Before parents,
Where lies the true origin?
Recognizing the subtle and tranquil,
Reversing the sun and moon.
Subtly attaining the natural,
Serene and ascending as an immortal.
To refine the great elixir,
Where is the best place to dwell?
The grotto-heavens are not far—
Leisurely departing with the clouds.
Eternally numinous, never aging,
The illusory body has its allotted span.
Life’s radiance shines round,
Without coming or going.
Moreover—
The utmost Dao is subtle and tranquil,
Who from ancient times to now has known it?
Beyond yin and yang,
Awakening to its wondrous subtlety.
The Dao transcends form and emptiness,
Non-action responding to action.
Pure and true, unchanging,
This is the ladder to the heavens.
Naturally inverting,
Revolving Kan to welcome Li.
Forgetting emotions to preserve life,
The bright moon suffers no loss.
White clouds come and go,
Trusting east or west.
To harmonize the Red Phoenix,
Truly embrace the Black Tortoise.
All falsities seen through,
Outwardly appearing foolish.
Only extolling others’ virtues,
Constantly examining one’s own faults.
Suddenly forgetting love and hate,
Mind without high or low.
Moreover—
The true immortal’s arts employ,
The numinous tortoise harmonizes the phoenix.
Grasping yin and yang,
The wondrous function of vacuity.
Amidst a myriad scenes,
Neither still nor moving.
Once dwelling in the capital,
Muddling through the world, forgetting dreams.
The Dao and virtue, subtle and tranquil,
Who from ancient times to now has upheld them?
A single spirit pearl,
Naturally played with.
All supervisors and overseers,
Presenting this humble ode.
The Daoist realm, serene and peaceful,
Fearing only disgrace or favor.
The descent of the Great Luo’s sages,
Fragrant winds bearing them.
Moreover—
Those near the altar rites, listen—
Abstain from meat, still the body.
Suffering oneself, without selfishness,
Gaining some merit and deeds.
If one violates heaven’s precepts,
Years of calamity, months of illness.
Responding to things, forgetting dust,
An inch of spirit like a mirror.
Officials and spirits silently observe,
Thought by thought, the heart upright.
Abandoning hate, exhausting love,
Clear, unobstructed, and equal.
To escape the wheel of rebirth,
Take refuge in the worthies and sages.
Moreover—
The vast sea humbles itself,
Myriad streams return clear.
The utmost Dao is formless,
Wondrously emerging from the finest hairs.
A welling spring of wisdom,
Grasping the meaning, forgetting knowledge.
Nurturing the true to preserve life,
Who from ancient times to now has relied on it?
Still and silent, unchanging,
This is the ladder to the heavens.
Muddling through the capital,
Alone delighting in the subtle and tranquil.
Naturally attaining principle,
Without awakening or delusion.
Suddenly comprehending the Three Teachings,
What further doubts remain?
The lotus root in the mud,
The lotus rising from the green mire.
Responding to transformations, forgetting words,
Non-action responding to action.
Cultivating true subtlety,
Outwardly appearing foolish.
Qi and spirit meet,
Conjoining Kan to welcome Li.
The world lacks those willing to awaken,
Thus hiding by clear streams.
The twelve divisions of the celestial cycle,
Leisurely drinking the elixir.
In years past, treading the clouds,
Once traversing the passes of the west.
Just like a child,
White hair hastens.
The immortal’s affairs unfinished,
The ghostly messengers are hard to evade.
Refining soul and spirit to perfection,
The precious mirror suffers no loss.
Beyond yin and yang,
The sun and moon ever follow.
Let the human world
Speak of right and wrong.
The grotto-heavens are not far,
Yet those who arrive are truly few.
All transgressions dissolved,
Forever freed from the wheel of rebirth.
Moreover—
Knowing the dust of the world departs,
Without contention, truly awakened.
Reciting the Dao, serene and peaceful,
Brushing away all sorrow and care.
Loving what is not loved,
The lofty immortals approve.
The awakened nature, bright and constant,
Not an inch of joy or anger.
Do not say it is wrong,
Leisurely discussing past and present.
Born in the Central Land,
Early seek the immortal’s path.
Forgetting emotions to preserve life,
Clearly penetrating mother and child.

**[For the Daoist Assembly]**

chunks.original_text: 辛酉岁下元，滨州放录，立余为度师，余不从，酬赠。 圣经符箓，太上为师。 五师假度，万物无私。 深藏三宝，终始一时。 古今仙贤，个个真慈。 道传微妙，瞬目扬眉。 磨开慧剑，灵镇蛇龟。 中边一弗，达理无疑。 常赞人美，只搜己非。 尽除我相，德归谦卑。 真平至行，抱一无离。 住行坐外，运坎迎离。 知白守黑，不让围碁。 自然万慧，明者实稀。 灵丹一粒，罪病都医。 修完性命，鬼使难追。 真无喜怒，碧汉霄挮。 认得真容，胜礼牟尼。 炼成七宝，免贩行尸。 救生拔死，闲乐希夷。 天条莫犯，国法遵依。 了真道貌，似月无亏。 隐光混浊，外若憨痴。 洞天吟咏，诗曲欣题。 松前石畔，神饮刀圭。 因何厌世，无个真依。 休昧方寸，贤圣暗随。 去恶忘贪，更没灾危。 出离五道，免了披皮。 朝元路上，体挂仙衣。 海变桑田，亘貌无衰。 阴阳之外，生灭难催。 应为功德，福过须弥。 授传敬信，下手休迟，清静到头，功有高低。 上升天堂，下免阴司。 世迷情爱，气断是谁。 如庞似许，永免轮回。 又 真人大师，未敢容易。 久闻至德，清名无比。 广积洪禧，昔年混世。 福地洞天，也曾云水。 磻石松前，烹铅炼已。 内功预了，古今有几。 顿悟归依，蓬莱一会。 又 人间世爱，应景芬芳。 仙家美景，四序有常。 觉花无谢，隐在中央，天香坠落，自然异香。 慧眸能见，别是重阳。 蓬壶阆苑，不谢真光。 云亭仙乐，不让高堂。 乘风要去，却到仙乡。 各全功行，慢慢休忙。 又 处玄到州，不要恁到。 各各念道，始终常好。 会上每月，不得求告。 三请不来，不要有懊。 却生嗔怒，死参阎老。 无罪欢乐，胜贪苦恼。 天元将尽，难逢正教。 肯信余言，真游蓬岛。 又 甲辰登郡，黄箓重兴。 昌阳感应，昼见明星。 祖师预显，下元文登。 白龟莲衬，真异分明。 资圣宫题，升化南京。 四友守坟，曾近上清。 同居五载，云水闲行。 天元将尽，未得真宁。 汞铅炼就，别有真形。 上敬奉三教道众并述怀 万经顿悟，清静功夫。 真要道成，至死如初。 寸灵明了，外貌若愚。 夏凉冬暖，闲看仙书。 松筠石畔，自在清居。 万愆不造，旧业消除。 炼成三宝，蜕下凡躯。 赵却轮回，升入虚无。 大罗朝圣，永住天都。 又 自揣难当，广惠道粮。
chunks.translated_text:
In the lower Yuan of the Xinyou year, Binzhou issued a register, appointing me as a master of ordination. I declined, yet offered this in response:

The sacred scriptures and talismanic registers—
the Most High alone is master.
Though five masters confer ordination,
the myriad things remain selfless.
Deeply treasuring the Three Jewels,
beginning and end are one moment.
From ancient times to now, immortals and sages,
each one truly compassionate.
The Dao transmits subtleties—
in the blink of an eye, brows raised.
Polishing the sword of wisdom,
the numinous subdues snake and tortoise.
Within and without, not a hair’s difference,
penetrating principle without doubt.
Ever praising others’ virtues,
only searching out one’s own faults.
Utterly dissolving the self’s form,
virtue returns to humility.
True equanimity in conduct,
embracing the One without parting.
In dwelling, walking, sitting—
revolving Kan to welcome Li.
Knowing the white, guarding the black,
not yielding even to encircling stones.
Naturally possessing ten thousand wisdoms,
yet those who are enlightened are truly few.
A single grain of numinous elixir
cures all sins and ailments.
Cultivating and perfecting nature and life,
even ghostly messengers cannot pursue.
Truly without joy or anger,
ascending the azure vault of heaven.
Recognizing the true countenance
surpasses worship of the Muni.
Refining the Seven Treasures,
one escapes the trade of the walking corpse.
Saving the living, delivering the dead,
leisurely delighting in the subtle and serene.
Heaven’s precepts must not be violated,
the laws of the land are to be obeyed.
Realizing the true Daoist visage,
like the moon, never waning.
Concealing radiance amid turbidity,
outwardly appearing simple and foolish.
In grotto-heavens, chanting verses,
poems and songs joyfully inscribed.
Before pines and beside rocks,
spirit drinks the medicinal spoon.
Why weary of the world?
There is no true refuge.
Do not obscure the square inch of the heart—
sages and worthies silently follow.
Abandoning evil, forgetting greed,
no further calamities or dangers arise.
Emerging from the Five Paths,
one escapes donning the skin.
On the road to the Court of Primordial Origin,
the body is draped in immortal robes.
Seas transform into mulberry fields,
yet the visage remains unchanged, undecaying.
Beyond yin and yang,
birth and extinction cannot hasten.
As merit and virtue accrue,
blessings surpass Mount Sumeru.
Receive transmission with reverence and faith—
delay not in setting to work.
When purity reaches its culmination,
merit may be high or low.
Ascending to heaven above,
below, one avoids the courts of darkness.
The world deluded by love and passion—
who severs the qi?
Like Pang and Xu,
forever freed from the wheel of rebirth.

Moreover—
True Persons and great masters,
one dare not treat lightly.
Long have I heard of their supreme virtue,
their pure renown without compare.
Vastly accumulating great felicity,
in years past, mingling with the world.
In blessed lands and grotto-heavens,
they too once wandered as clouds and waters.
Before the pines of Pan’s Stone,
they refined lead and tempered the self.
Inner work completed beforehand—
how many through the ages?
Suddenly awakened, taking refuge,
a single assembly on Penglai.

Moreover—
The world’s loves are ephemeral,
fragrant only for the season.
The immortals’ fair scenes
follow the four seasons in constancy.
The flower of awakening never fades,
hidden at the center.
Heavenly fragrance descends,
naturally wafting rare perfumes.
With eyes of wisdom, one sees—
it is another Chongyang.
Penglai and Langyuan,
their true light never fades.
The cloud pavilion’s immortal music
does not yield to grand halls.
Riding the wind, one departs,
arriving in the immortal realm.
Each perfects merit and conduct—
take your time, do not rush.

Moreover—
Arriving in Xuan at the prefecture,
do not act so hastily.
Each must recite the Dao,
from beginning to end, ever well.
At monthly assemblies,
do not make requests.
If three invitations go unanswered,
do not grow remorseful.
Should anger arise instead,
one will face old Yan at death.
Without transgression, joy abounds—
better than suffering from greed.
As the Heavenly Origin nears its end,
the true teaching is hard to encounter.
If you heed my words,
you will truly wander Peng Island.

Moreover—
In the Jiachen year, ascending the prefecture,
the Yellow Register was revived.
In Changyang, omens appeared—
by day, a bright star was seen.
The Patriarch manifested beforehand,
in the lower Yuan at Wendeng.
A white tortoise on a lotus pedestal—
the true marvel was clear.
Inscribed at Zisheng Abbey,
ascending and transforming in Nanjing.
Four companions guarded the tomb,
once near the Upper Clarity.
Dwelling together for five years,
wandering as clouds and waters.
As the Heavenly Origin nears its end,
true tranquility is not yet attained.
Mercury and lead refined,
another true form emerges.

Respectfully offering to the assembly of the Three Teachings’ Daoist followers and expressing my sentiments—

Myriad scriptures suddenly awakened,
the work of purity and stillness.
To truly accomplish the Dao,
from beginning to end, unwavering.
The square inch of spirit luminous,
outwardly appearing foolish.
Cool in summer, warm in winter,
leisurely perusing immortal texts.
Beside pines and bamboos, by rocks,
dwelling in carefree purity.
No transgressions committed,
old karma dissolved.
Refining the Three Jewels,
shedding the mortal frame.
Escaping the wheel of rebirth,
ascending into the Void.
Paying homage at the Great Lofty Court,
eternally abiding in the Heavenly Capital.

Moreover—
Self-reflecting, I am unworthy,
yet widely bestowing the Dao’s sustenance.
chunks.overlap_context:
owing the dust of the world departs,
Without contention, truly awakened.
Reciting the Dao, serene and peaceful,
Brushing away all sorrow and care.
Loving what is not loved,
The lofty immortals approve.
The awakened nature, bright and constant,
Not an inch of joy or anger.
Do not say it is wrong,
Leisurely discussing past and present.
Born in the Central Land,
Early seek the immortal’s path.
Forgetting emotions to preserve life,
Clearly penetrating mother and child.

**[For the Daoist Assembly]**

chunks.original_text: 我无功行，劝恁从长。 少贪忘欲，增福安康。 田蚕要广，悟玺省亡。 时时煎熬，日日无常。 不修性命，金宝多藏。 恶业将去，财与儿郎。 真心顿觉，仿效丹阳。 救生拔死，德徧十方。 厌居人世，升入仙乡。 又 子孙成行，大限难替。 今古人间，悟者有几。 苦海漂沉，无个超彼。 万中未有，一人无毁。 心违道德，只争名利。 弗修性命，怎免下鬼。 去尽贪嗔，神仙活计。 大限临头，犹然恋世。 又 名山书院，闲挂琴剑。 万卷圣经，忻时频检。 自然达理，了真灵验。 松峰霞洞，世伪好闪。 高卧磻石，清居永占。 意想名利，难趖巅崄。 古来烈士，磨开一点。 迸出灵珠，现出光焰。 烧见亘容，道有顿渐。 八卦微通，色空弗染。 扬人之美，丑恶却掩。 功行周圆，无思忘念。 又 未能出去，且如庞许。 全家了道，名传万古。 意泯贪争，认得乌兔。 自然之道，倒颠子午。 达理明真，便知宗祖。 顿觉真常，也无舍取。 真乐清平，玉皇仙举。 出离生灭，大罗天住。 功行未圆，志坚淡素。 始终不变，圣贤来度。 三教高真，便是师父。 又 普劝诸公，先行孝道。 无事筠轩，闲看庄老。 今古人间，几个明奥。 觉了希夷，认得亘貌。 蓬莱云路，行道须到。 弗造万愆，寸无苦恼。 意洽天心，出言妙教。 不论他非，高真许好。 不测无常，修真宜早。 得道成仙，免参阎老。 又 一别贵县，十有三年。 幻躯衰老，真未成仙。 行未八百，功过三千。 三教归一，弗论道禅。 见性成佛，炼汞通铅。 天道无言，圣道暗传。 上士飞升，中下延全。 生在中华，难遇天元。 又 昔年游历，曾到嵩阳。 达磨面壁，九载真忘。 论大包天，微出毫芒。 阴阳之外，趖了无常。 松峰霞洞，胜住高堂。 壶天日月，昼夜偏长。 清平妙用，功行圆方。 火坑出了，别有炎凉。 又 寻常交易，念道两平。 应有买卖，莫要相争。 行在刀尺，功认斤星。 真通好事，出语如经。 和睦孝顺，胜似人情。 言他丑恶，却要休听。 心崇至德，外应虚名。 真生敬信，保命通灵。 抱道真常，免堕幽冥。 他年归去，蓬岛游行。 又 朝参暮礼，常爇名香。
chunks.translated_text:
I have no meritorious deeds or virtuous conduct—
I urge you to consider deeply.
Curb greed, forget desire,
to augment fortune and secure well-being.
Expand your fields and silkworm farms,
awaken to the seal and reduce loss.
Constantly refined and tempered,
each day faces impermanence.
Without cultivating nature and life,
gold and treasures amass in vain.
As evil karma departs,
wealth and sons remain behind.
With a sudden awakening of the true heart,
follow the example of Dan Yang.
Rescuing the living, delivering the dead,
virtue pervades the ten directions.
Weary of dwelling in the human world,
ascend into the immortal realm.

Moreover—
Descendants may flourish in rows,
yet the great limit cannot be evaded.
From ancient times to the present in this world,
how few have awakened?
Adrift in the bitter sea,
none transcend its depths.
Among ten thousand, not one remains unscathed;
even the rarest may yet be ruined.
Hearts defying morality and the Dao,
contend only for fame and profit.
Failing to cultivate nature and life,
how can one avoid becoming a ghost below?
When greed and wrath are wholly dispelled,
the immortal’s livelihood is attained.
Though the great limit draws near,
still they cling to the world.

Moreover—
In renowned mountains and academies,
quietly hang zither and sword.
Myriad sacred scriptures,
joyfully perused in leisure.
Naturally comprehending principle,
fully realizing true efficacy.
Amid pine peaks and rosy grottoes,
the world’s falsity is shunned.
Reclining on Pan’s stone,
eternally dwelling in purity.
If the mind fixates on fame and profit,
the perilous summit is hard to scale.
Since ancient times, the resolute,
have ground away but a single speck—
releasing the luminous pearl,
radiating its brilliance.
Burning to perceive the eternal countenance,
the Dao unfolds in sudden and gradual ways.
The eight trigrams faintly grasped,
form and emptiness remain unstained.
Extolling others’ virtues,
concealing their flaws.
Merit and conduct perfected,
thoughts and cares forgotten.

Moreover—
Unable to depart yet,
like Pang and Xu,
the whole family attained the Dao,
their names transmitted through the ages.
Desires for greed and contention extinguished,
recognizing the crow and hare.
The natural Dao,
inverts the cycles of Zi and Wu.
Comprehending principle and illuminating truth,
one knows the ancestral origin.
Suddenly awakening to the true and constant,
there is neither grasping nor relinquishing.
In true joy and purity,
the Jade Emperor elevates one to immortality.
Emerging from birth and extinction,
abiding in the Great Lofty Heaven.
Though merit and conduct remain imperfect,
the will stands firm in simplicity.
Unchanging from beginning to end,
sages and worthies come to deliver.
The lofty perfected of the Three Teachings,
are your true masters.

Moreover—
Universally exhorting all,
first practice filial piety.
At ease in the bamboo pavilion,
leisurely peruse the *Zhuangzi* and *Laozi*.
From ancient times to the present in this world,
how few have fathomed their mysteries?
Awakening to the subtle and imperceptible,
recognizing the eternal countenance.
On Penglai’s cloud paths,
one must walk the Dao to arrive.
Without committing myriad transgressions,
not an inch of suffering remains.
Harmonizing with the heart of Heaven,
uttering wondrous teachings.
Not discussing others’ faults,
the lofty perfected approve.
Impermanence is unfathomable—
cultivate truth early.
Attaining the Dao and becoming immortal,
one avoids facing King Yama.

Moreover—
Since parting from your noble county,
thirteen years have passed.
This illusory body decays with age,
yet true immortality remains unattained.
Deeds fall short of eight hundred,
while transgressions number three thousand.
The Three Teachings converge as one—
no debate between Dao and Chan.
Seeing nature, one becomes Buddha;
refining mercury to merge with lead.
The heavenly Dao is wordless,
the sagely Dao is secretly transmitted.
Superior practitioners ascend in flight,
the middling and lesser prolong their lives.
Born in the Central Kingdom,
it is rare to encounter the celestial origin.

Moreover—
In years past, I traveled,
once visiting Songyang.
Bodhidharma faced the wall,
nine years in true oblivion.
Discoursing on the vastness that encompasses Heaven,
subtly surpassing the finest hair.
Beyond yin and yang,
transcending impermanence.
Amid pine peaks and rosy grottoes,
dwelling surpasses lofty halls.
Within the gourd’s heaven, sun and moon,
day and night stretch long.
In purity and wondrous practice,
merit and conduct attain perfection.
Emerging from the fiery pit,
one encounters a different warmth and chill.

Moreover—
In ordinary dealings,
balance devotion to the Dao with fairness.
When transactions arise,
refrain from contention.
Conduct measured by rule and scale,
merit recognized by weight and star.
Truly understanding good deeds,
speak as if reciting scripture.
Harmony and filial piety,
surpass mere human sentiment.
Speaking of others’ flaws,
best not to listen.
The heart reveres supreme virtue,
while outwardly responding to empty fame.
Truly born of reverence and faith,
preserving life and penetrating the numinous.
Embracing the Dao’s constancy,
one avoids falling into the netherworld.
In years to come, departing,
roaming Penglai’s isles.

Moreover—
From dawn to dusk, pay homage,
constantly burning incense of renown.

chunks.original_text: 清平福德，胜论仙方。 戒杀生灵，合宅安康。 悟道意闲，迷俗心忙。 不造阴罪，便见天堂。 松筠为伴，四序炎凉。 瑶台阆苑，要去休忘。 真无挂碍，得到仙乡。 又 无能无德，厚礼难当。 远远相接，又献琼浆。 尊官二姓，共是重阳。 功成名遂，却慕仙乡。 人间万事，顿觉俱忘。 道性真通，汞库铅房。 蓬莱云路，别有清凉。 又 天道难言，命住光传。 休生爱欲，炼就汞铅。 出离物我，抱道通仙。 行全八百，功满三千。 灵峰洞外，闲对林泉。 常餐淡素，意远腥膻。 琴书为伴，高卧云烟。 他年归去，独步朝元。 又
chunks.translated_text:
Pure peace and blessed virtue surpass all immortal formulas.
Refrain from harming living spirits—
the whole household finds peace and well-being.
Awakened to the Dao, the mind is at ease;
deluded by the world, the heart is restless.
Without creating hidden transgressions,
one beholds heaven’s halls.
Pine and bamboo as companions,
through the four seasons’ warmth and chill.
Jade terraces and Penglai’s gardens—
when the time comes to depart, do not forget.
Truly free from entanglements,
one arrives at the immortal realm.

Moreover—
Without ability or virtue,
profound offerings are hard to accept.
From afar, they come to greet,
again presenting jade-like nectar.
Honored officials of two clans,
both revering the Double Yang.
When merit is complete and fame achieved,
they yearn for the immortal realm.
All worldly affairs,
suddenly seem entirely forgotten.
The Dao-nature truly awakened,
in the mercury storehouse and lead chamber.
Upon Penglai’s clouded paths,
lies a different cool serenity.

Moreover—
The Way of Heaven is hard to describe;
life abides where light is transmitted.
Cease the arising of desire,
and refine mercury and lead.
Transcend self and other,
embracing the Dao to commune with immortals.
Walking the full eight hundred,
fulfilling the three thousand merits.
Beyond Spirit Peak Cave,
leisurely facing forests and springs.
Ever dining on plain simplicity,
the mind distant from flesh and fish.
Zither and books as companions,
reclining high amidst clouds and mist.
In years to come, departing,
alone stepping toward the primordial dawn.

Moreover—

chunks.original_text: 明真之醮，所料紧要。 荐拔先灵，各愿管了。 休问使钱，共用多少。 收支无私，置历二道。 临醮众人，戒欲为妙。 且远腥膻，纵意寿夭。 吏神暗察，罪福非小。 近醮朝真，不得唤叫。 高功道法。 显扬大教。 所篆符简，众职明晓。 追荐文字，未有别料。 百日之功，莫生虚矫。 季冬望后，要显光耀。 休分昼夜，俗事除剿。 〔辞马姑〕 马姑到东莱州近二载，满郡奉道之家，各见敬爱。 却要去都下，所言有些小事未了。 中秋旦后相辞，信笔数言，自知未达曰 大道无为，真应有为。 无形有相，福行施为。 不造万愆，顿觉真为。 不贪万有，物外清为。 不生万恶，应化善为。 不起万憎，应化德为。 道阐万理，应化贤为。 世明万信，应化经为。 金刚四句，应化禅为。 周易造化，应化卦为。 道德五千，应化修为。 十方三界，三教广为。 万法无分，天下敬为。 上报四恩，无为不为。 又 无修有修，无为应为。 无着无离，无大无微。 无憎无爱，无是无非。 无增无减，无高无低。 无收无取，无悄无痴。 无中应物，无虑无机。 自然颠倒，言东悟西。 见喜却怒，许省是迷。 道无形体，无想无知。 真常无变，无妄无疑。 无来无去，霄汉之梯。 无动无作，运坎迎离。 无情亘貌，婴姹相随。 无物之象，古今明稀。 藕在水中，莲朵出泥。 既超彼岸，丹阳教依。 又
chunks.translated_text:
The Rite of Illuminating the True holds matters most pressing.
To deliver and uplift ancestral spirits—each vow must be fulfilled.
Ask not of the silver spent, nor the sum required.
Account with impartiality, keeping two ledgers of receipt and disbursement.
As the rite approaches, all participants must guard desire as paramount.
Keep far from the rank and foul, lest life be cut short or prolonged at whim.
The spirits and officials observe in secret—reward and retribution are no trifling matter.

When drawing near the rite to greet the True,
let no clamor or outcry arise.
The High Merit’s Daoist arts
shall manifest and propagate the Great Teaching.
The talismans and petitions inscribed—
let all officers clearly understand.
The texts for deliverance require no separate provisions.
A hundred days of effort must not lapse into false pretense.
After the full moon of late winter,
radiance must be made manifest.
Divide not day from night,
and cut away all worldly affairs.

[Farewell to Ma Gu]
Ma Gu has dwelt near Donglai Prefecture for nearly two years,
and in every household that reveres the Dao, she has been held in esteem and affection.
Yet now she must depart for the capital,
for some small matters remain unfinished.
After the Mid-Autumn dawn, she will take her leave,
jotting these few words in haste, knowing they fall short:

The Great Dao is non-action, yet the True responds with action.
Formless yet manifest, blessings arise from deeds performed.
By not committing myriad transgressions,
one suddenly awakens to true conduct.
By not coveting the ten thousand things,
one attains purity beyond the world.
By not giving rise to myriad evils,
one transforms through goodness.
By not stirring myriad hatreds,
one transforms through virtue.
As the Dao unfolds the myriad principles,
one transforms through wisdom.
As the world illuminates the myriad truths,
one transforms through scripture.
The four lines of the *Vajra*,
transform through Chan.
The *Zhouyi*’s creative transformations,
transform through hexagrams.
The *Daodejing*’s five thousand characters,
transform through cultivation.
The ten directions and three realms—
the Three Teachings spread widely.
Though the myriad methods are undivided,
the world reveres them as one.

To repay the Four Graces,
there is nothing the non-action does not accomplish.

Moreover—
Without cultivation, there is cultivation;
without action, there is responsive action.
Without attachment, without detachment,
without greatness, without minuteness.
Without hatred, without love,
without right, without wrong.
Without increase, without decrease,
without high, without low.
Without taking, without seizing,
without sorrow, without delusion.
Within non-being, one responds to things,
without thought, without cunning.
Naturally inverted,
speaking east yet awakening west.
Seeing joy, one grows angry;
promising insight, one remains deluded.
The Dao has no form,
no thought, no knowledge.
Eternally unchanging,
without falsehood, without doubt.
Without coming, without going—
the ladder to the clouds and heavens.
Without movement, without effort,
revolving Kan to welcome Li.
Without emotion, yet ever-present in form,
Infant and Maiden follow in tandem.
The image of no-thing—
rarely understood from ancient times to now.
The lotus root lies in water,
yet the lotus blossom rises from the mud.
Having transcended the far shore,
follow the teachings of Danyang.

Moreover—

chunks.original_text: 真隐辽阳，敬奉丹阳。 万事无心，渐得道阳。 尽恶常善，达理明阳。 寸无贪争，体变真阳。 碧天青莹，光显太阳。 宝光无缺，混合阴阳。 命清无漏，火炼灵阳。 自然颠倒，微妙通阳。 他年归去，重礼重阳。 又 守道无愆，慧目观天。 无中妙有，汞结灵铅。 行全八百，功了三千。 傻猿缚住，迸出光圆。 冲和黍米，道意如渊。 自然达理，云水溪边。 琴书作伴，自在修仙。 冬藏云洞，夏卧松轩。 欣时歌舞，静看诗篇。 携笻顶笠，终始真坚。 古今达者，清隐高贤。 又 昌阳石岭，有塔善敬。 茅屋仙居，礼参大圣。 道论阴阳，释明见性。 文宣五常，外应百行。 万法千门，无分平等。 尽除憎爱，真无罪病。 不犯天条，达理归正，真斋真戒，身心清静。 只修道德，利名休竞。 去恶冲和，忘情保命。 天莹光圆，胜如入定。 至妙希夷，绝其视听。 古往今来，几人顿省。 贤圣虚空，化世应影。 金刚四句，善通敬顶。 了一去朝，上清真境。 又 身似环墙，四面生光。 无中明有，真悟丹阳。 妙通恍惚，自然真常。 口应声随，俗念俱忘。 世无知音，幽阒潜藏。 茅舍清居，胜住高堂。 蓬莱云路，要去休忙。 壶天妙景，昼夜非常。 花开不谢，阆苑仙乡。 海变松枯，永免丘荒。 养成道体，体挂云裳。 大罗归去，朝现天皇。 又 方寸无尘，灵真如镜。 应物明通，至性保命。 调和道气，念无罪病。 苦处争先，一切平等。 依此行持，便是功行。 缚住心猿，胜似入定。 不着有无，俱忘动静。 憎爱是非，益真可听。 美言多邪，清一多正。 始终弗变，了真朝圣。 又 去恶善生，忘情命生。 厌伪真生，意平德生。 心通慧生，见道无生。 尽浊清生，阴尽阳生。 性定光生，敬参应生。 大慈救生，道用微生。 又 既慕林泉，耕透灵田。 苦形心尽，保养真铅。 松前石畔，趖了熬煎。 贪争远却，达道通仙。 隐居世外，高卧云轩。 自然应变； 妙慧观天。 理明释藏，不让参挥。 闲穷三教，得意忘言。 又 上士无争，应物常平。 不贪外宝，道合真灵。 理明正教，敬信来听。 方圆随顺，救死哀生。 有心忘世，无意身荣。 六铢天赐，换却伪形。 完全功行，胜殢声名。 了真归去，朝现三清。 又 万事知空，顿忘人我。 外应福行，无为成果。 真通柔弱，妙明降火。 灵耀常看。 金关玉锁。 自然有作，住行坐卧。 剔开道眼，进出珠颗。 闹裹无心，性如莲朵。 理达希夷，古今几个。 体变纯阳，蜕形无堕。 又 身混世境，不动真静，斡运丙阳，自然焕炳。 道慧通天，宝光如镜。 应物德全，达无罪病。 妙觉真常，破妄归正。 气神相见，命住性定。 水善清柔，贯透刚硬。 上士无争，非是莫听。 尽除憎爱，寸灵平等。 万万学道，一二顿省。 弗思美膳，乞觅余剩。 贫裹藏真，他年朝圣。 又
chunks.translated_text:
In true reclusion at Liaoyang, reverently serving Danyang.
All affairs met without intent—gradually attaining the Yang of the Dao.
Evil exhausted, goodness ever-present—penetrating principle, illuminating Yang.
Not an inch of greed or strife—embodying the true Yang.
Azure sky, crystalline and bright—radiance revealing the Great Yang.
Precious light unbroken, merging Yin and Yang.
Life purified, without leakage—refined by fire, the numinous Yang.
Naturally inverted—subtly wondrous, pervading Yang.
In years to come, returning—reverently bowing to Chongyang.

Moreover—
Guarding the Dao without fault, wisdom’s eye gazing at heaven.
Within non-being, the marvelous exists—mercury congeals with numinous lead.
Walking the full eight hundred, completing the three thousand merits.
The foolish ape bound—bursting forth with luminous perfection.
Harmonious millet grain—Dao’s intent profound as an abyss.
Naturally penetrating principle—by clouded streams and flowing waters.
Lute and books as companions—at ease in cultivation.
Winter dwelling in clouded caves, summer resting in pine pavilions.
Delighting in song and dance, silently contemplating poetry.
Staff in hand, bamboo hat atop—steadfast from beginning to end.
From ancient times to now, those who attain—reclusive sages of purity.

Moreover—
At Changyang’s Stone Ridge, a pagoda venerates goodness.
Thatched hut as immortal abode—paying homage to the Great Sage.
Discoursing on Yin and Yang, Buddhism clarifies seeing nature.
Proclaiming the Five Constants, outwardly corresponding to the hundred practices.
Myriad dharmas, thousand gates—without distinction, all equal.
Utterly eradicating aversion and attachment—truly without fault or affliction.
Not transgressing heaven’s precepts—penetrating principle, returning to rectitude.
True fasting, true precepts—body and mind purified.
Cultivating only virtue and power, forsaking competition for profit and fame.
Abandoning evil, embracing harmony—forgetting emotion to preserve life.
Heaven’s radiance, luminous and perfect—surpassing even deep meditation.
Utterly wondrous, beyond sound and sight—cutting off perception and hearing.
From ancient times to now—how few suddenly awaken?
Sages and worthies, empty and vast—transforming the world, responding like shadows.
The four lines of the Vajra—reverently penetrating the crown.
Completion attained, one departs to ascend—the true realm of Supreme Clarity.

Moreover—
The body like a circular wall—light emanating from all sides.
Within non-being, luminous existence—truly awakening to Danyang.
Wondrously pervading the indistinct—naturally the true constant.
Mouth responding, voice following—worldly thoughts all forgotten.
The world lacking kindred spirits—secluded in quiet obscurity.
Dwelling in a thatched hut—surpassing grand halls.
The clouded paths of Penglai—no need to hasten departure.
The wondrous scenes of Hu Tian—day and night extraordinary.
Flowers blooming without wilting—the immortal realms of Lang Garden.
Seas turning to withered pines—forever spared the desolation of mounds.
Nurturing the Dao-body—robed in clouded garments.
Returning to the Great Luo—appearing before the Heavenly Sovereign.

Moreover—
The square inch free of dust—spirit and truth like a mirror.
Responding to things with clarity—preserving life through utmost nature.
Harmonizing the qi of the Dao—thoughts without fault or affliction.
In suffering, taking the lead—all things equal.
Following this practice—this is meritorious conduct.
Binding the mind’s ape—surpassing even deep meditation.
Not clinging to being or non-being—forgetting both movement and stillness.
Aversion, attachment, right, wrong—benefiting the true, what can be heard?
Fair words often deceptive—purity alone is correct.
Unchanging from beginning to end—completing the true, ascending to the sacred.

Moreover—
Abandoning evil, goodness arises—forgetting emotion, life arises.
Wearying of falsity, truth arises—intent settled, virtue arises.
Mind penetrating, wisdom arises—seeing the Dao, non-arising arises.
All turbidity cleansed, clarity arises—Yin exhausted, Yang arises.
Nature stabilized, light arises—reverent devotion, response arises.
Great compassion, salvation arises—Dao’s function, subtly arises.

Moreover—
Having admired forests and springs—plowing through the numinous field.
Exhausting bodily toil, the heart’s intent—preserving and nurturing true lead.
Before pines and beside stones—enduring the trials of refinement.
Greed and strife cast far away—attaining the Dao, transcending as immortals.
Dwelling in seclusion beyond the world—reclining high in clouded pavilions.
Naturally adapting to change—wondrous wisdom observing heaven.
Principles bright, Buddhist teachings profound—not yielding to Chan’s probing.
Leisurely mastering the Three Teachings—grasping meaning, forgetting words.

Moreover—
The superior person contends not—responding to things with constant equanimity.
Not coveting external treasures—Dao harmonizing with true numinosity.
Principles bright in the orthodox teaching—reverently believing, coming to listen.
Adapting to square and round—rescuing the dying, mourning the living.
With intent forgetting the world—without desire for bodily glory.
Six *zhu* bestowed by heaven—exchanging the false form.
Perfecting merit and conduct—surpassing entanglement in fame.
Completing the true, returning—appearing before the Three Clarities.

Moreover—
All affairs known as empty—suddenly forgetting self and others.
Outwardly corresponding to blessed conduct—effortlessly bearing fruit.
Truly penetrating softness and weakness—wondrously illuminating, descending fire.
Numinous radiance ever-present—golden barrier, jade lock.
Naturally acting—whether dwelling, walking, sitting, or lying.
Scooping open the Dao-eye—pearls emerging.
Amidst clamor, without intent—nature like a lotus blossom.
Principles penetrating the subtle—how few from ancient times to now?
Body transformed into pure Yang—shedding form without falling.

Moreover—
Body mingling with worldly realms—yet unmoving in true stillness.
Revolving the fire of Bing—naturally resplendent.
Dao’s wisdom pervading heaven—precious light like a mirror.
Responding to things, virtue complete—penetrating without fault or affliction.
Wondrously awakening to the true constant—shattering delusion, returning to rectitude.
Qi and spirit meeting—life preserved, nature stabilized.
Water’s goodness, clear and soft—permeating hardness.
The superior person contends not—only the unenlightened fail to listen.
Utterly eradicating aversion and attachment—inch of spirit, all equal.
Of ten thousand who study the Dao—one or two suddenly awaken.
Not craving fine delicacies—begging for leftovers.
Amidst poverty, concealing truth—one day ascending to the sacred.
Moreover—

chunks.translated_text:
The true work of purity and stillness—
responding to things with subtle penetration.
Body like the lotus root—
heart the palace of the lotus.

White clouds emerge from the peaks—
free in the empty sky.
False words, turbid qi—
mouth responds as if deaf.

The pivot of utmost clarity—
not shared with the world.
No entanglement in being or non-being—
Dao-nature harmonious and balanced.

Once the monkey-mind is settled—
tiger and dragon subdued.
Naturally clear and luminous—
the sacred peak of the other shore.

Cultivating the Three Treasures—
outwardly appearing impoverished.
In later years, weary of falsity—
idly keeping company with towering pines.

Moreover—
In ascent and descent, offer reverence—
do not disturb the multitude.
Only according to the assembly’s means—
follow where funds are few.

Each household faces hardship—
rely on frugality and moderation.
Heaven and humans observe in secret—
do not misuse the heart.

Selfless deeds bring abundant fortune—
transgressions weigh heavily as sin.

Moreover—
Restrain desire to lessen illness—
true equilibrium accumulates merit.
Mindful of the Dao, forget the dust—
the heart-monkey bound and stilled.

Ten thousand *yi* of yellow gold—
cannot purchase one’s nature and life.
The Three Teachings return to refuge—
wisdom’s light gradually brightens.

Emulating Xu and Pang—
truly ascending to the sacred court.

Moreover—
Beholding the register of immortals—
revering the Nine Heavens.
Ranked among the Three Purities—
Dharma beyond the two extremes.

Scriptures stored in myriad halls—
transforming the foolish into the wise.
The Dao of spontaneity—
refining mercury, simmering lead.

Walking the full eight hundred—
completing the three thousand merits.

chunks.translated_text:
The Dao-mind is vast and kind—
worldly cunning, harsh and cruel.
Karmic deeds pile high as mountains—
how can the hidden judge endure?

Vile illness clings to the body—
ghostly messengers press close.
Sins sink deep in darkest shadows—
grievances lead the way ahead.

Moreover—
The world’s deceit is not enduring—
restrain the heart-monkey’s leash.
Cultivate truth to transcend being—
escape the fires of suffering’s torment.

In clarity and peace delight in the Dao—
a single thought ascends to heaven.
Ever refine the mercury—
quell the passions, simmer the lead.

Walking the full eight hundred—
merits amassed to three thousand.
Sages of past and present—
through contemplation ascend as immortals.

Moreover—
Mindful of the Dao, forget the vulgar—
life preserved, desire extinguished.
No transgressions committed—
fortune in purity arises naturally.

Joyful nature on pine-clad peaks—
harmonizing gold and jade.
Precious radiance without flaw—
a crow sprouts three feet.

Subtle and wondrous, the mystery revealed—
cloud companions follow in pursuit.

Moreover—
Straying, one falls among beasts—
awakening, one joins the wise and holy.
Lost in turbid filth—
enlightened, one attains pure stillness.

The azure sky like water—
the image bright as a mirror.
Spending all one’s gold—
the heart’s sickness cannot be cured.
Ingesting the elixir’s measure—
the Dao harmonizes nature and life.
