chunks.original_text: 但见女男，如观父母。 意顺三毒，身受万苦。 知空厌世，云霞为侣。 出了阴阳，性超寒暑。 气结神灵，真明千古。 道乐清平。 无为仙举。 四言绝句 治政清通，为官忠孝。 节欲身安，他年蓬岛。 又 有缘再遇，重到东州。 外应因果，内隐真修。 又 人到如见，难当敬献。 念道思真，闲看经卷。 又 己未新秋，处暑清旦。 卧化超升，真归霄汉。 又 尊体安乐，别有期约。 忘尘念道，真通灵药。 又 无内修功，应有积行。 道意通天，一真得定。 又 恁助柴薪，我管功匠。 砖瓦烧成，再去重访。 又 既悟修仙，触处无烟。 心清得道，苦志常坚。 又 修行日用，去除憎爱。 降伏心意，应变通解。 又 掩非和众，清通日用。 要全性命，傻猿莫动。 又 气清无我，妙用真火。 烧见亘初，结成金果。 又 多僧伤行，多事伤神。 多欲伤命，多迷乱真。 又 事少心灵，念少无拘。 明少多愚，浊少通书。 又 妙道希夷，无着无离。 自然明了，贤圣皆知。 仙乐集卷之三竟 仙乐集卷之四
chunks.translated_text:
Seeing but women and men—
as one beholds father and mother.
The mind yields to the Three Poisons—
the body endures ten thousand sorrows.
Knowing emptiness, weary of the world—
clouds and mist become one’s companions.
Beyond yin and yang—
nature transcends cold and heat.
Qi congeals, spirit awakens—
true clarity spans the ages.
The Dao’s joy in pure tranquility—
immortality arises through non-action.

**Quatrain in Four Lines**
Governance clear and unobstructed—
officials loyal and filial.
Curbing desire, the body at peace—
in later years, Penglai Isle awaits.

Moreover—
By karmic affinity, we meet again—
returning once more to Dongzhou.
Externally, cause and effect manifest—
internally, true cultivation concealed.

Moreover—
To meet as if face-to-face—
hard to bear the reverent offering.
Mindful of the Dao, contemplating truth—
leisurely perusing the scriptures.

Moreover—
In the new autumn of *jiwei*,
on the clear dawn of *Chushu*,
lying in transformation, ascending beyond—
truly returning to the celestial vastness.

Moreover—
May your honored form be at ease—
parting holds another promised meeting.
Forget the dust, mindful of the Dao—
truly attaining the numinous elixir.

Moreover—
Without inner cultivation—
corresponding deeds must accumulate.
The Dao’s intent reaches heaven—
one truth attains stillness.

Moreover—
You supply the firewood—
I oversee the master craftsman.
When bricks and tiles are fired—
we shall visit once more.

Moreover—
Having awakened to immortal cultivation—
smoke arises nowhere.
The heart pure, the Dao attained—
austerity’s resolve ever steadfast.

Moreover—
In daily practice—
shed hatred and attachment.
Subduing the mind’s intent—
adapting with effortless mastery.

Moreover—
Concealing faults, harmonizing with others—
clarity and penetration in daily use.
To preserve nature and life—
the foolish ape must not stir.

Moreover—
Qi pure, self forgotten—
wondrous workings of true fire.
Burning to perceive the primal origin—
congealing into golden fruit.

Moreover—
Excessive austerity harms conduct—
excessive affairs harm the spirit.
Excessive desire harms life—
excessive delusion confounds truth.

Moreover—
Fewer affairs, the heart agile—
fewer thoughts, no constraints.
Less clarity, more folly—
less turbidity, greater penetration.

Moreover—

**Divine Mountain’s Effortless Response to Conditions**
*Composed by Perpetual Youth Liu Chuxuan*

**Verse Presented to the Prefectural Envoy, Officials, and Fellow Daoists**

Things and affairs—heart at rest, the Dao-eye opens,
The fetal immortal nurtured, floating jade cups.
Naturally awakened beyond yin and yang,
Riding the crane in true ascent—never to return.

**Jiangshenzi**

The Dao-heart differs from the worldly heart.
Awakened to emptiness, things and dust are contained.
Comprehending principle, illuminating truth,
Adapting naturally to change.
Love and hate, right and wrong—all unstained,
Roaming blessed lands,
Keeping company with pine-clad peaks.

The crane-body refined, soaring in azure skies,
Free to roam east or west, visiting Penglai’s palaces.
Transcending yin and yang,
Immortal life knows no end.
Seas may turn to dust, pines wither—yet the true never decays,
Rising beyond the Three Realms,
Following the immortal elders.

Today, the jade forest’s blossoms bloom in full,
With utmost true joy, three cups are drunk.
Carefree and tipsy—where to go?
To Penglai’s immortal realm, departing and returning.

**Four Poems in *Shangpingxi***

To think of a hundred years—like a single dream,
How fleeting the time.
The wondrous and subtle—merely this much.
If all would believe,
In daily matters, the myriad things bear no selfish intent.
In dwelling, walking, sitting, lying—true equality,
Adapting with true compassion.

Honor the Dao of immortals, clarify immortal principles,
Master immortal wonders, give thanks to immortal masters.
On Spirit Peak, idly gathering magic mushrooms,
In hidden grotto-heavens, the twelve celestial stems welcome *li*.
When the three fields’ work is complete, one ascends to the origin,
Shedding the walking corpse.

Again—

Arriving at the immortal garden,
Pines and bamboos emerald, peonies crimson.
In joyful purity—how many share this?
Forgetting the world’s dream,
All turns to emptiness in an instant.
Moon’s waxing and waning—like sorrow and joy,
Awakening to love’s weary heart.

True leisure is good, attaining leisure’s delight,
Mastering leisure’s wonders, perceiving leisure’s flow.
Moving the hexagrams, recognizing the ancestral luminous source.
Xu You and Pang Zu,
Already ascended to azure skies.
If all would follow this and honor the true Dao,
They would meet on Penglai’s isle.

Again—

Clinging to kindness and kinship,
Kindness breeds harm—death cannot be escaped.

chunks.translated_text:
When qi fails to come, the body lies in the wilds.
Changing heads and faces, how many thousands of times
Has the wheel of rebirth traded these bones?
Worldly splendor is no firmer than a spark,
A prison of fire and captivity.

Yet let one roam as cloud and water,
Ascend the cloud-path,
Wander beyond the clouds, play upon cloud-waves.
Spurning brocade robes, delight in donning hempen rags.
In pure peace and virtue,
Complete the cultivation of nature and life,
Dwelling hidden in thatched huts.
One day, shedding the shell to ascend before the sages,
One’s name is enrolled among the immortals’ ranks.

Again—

Reflect on human life:
Old and young, like spring and autumn.
Just in youth—suddenly turns to white-haired age.
Do not contend over emptiness and illusion,
For when the qi of impermanence severs, one lies in the wilds.
In all, thirty-six thousand days,
Mostly sick, mostly sorrowful.

Honor the true Dao,
Revere the true sages,
Illumine true principle,
Fulfill true cultivation.
Serve the two venerables, perfect filial piety in full.
The whole household is delivered,
Achieving merit, together they depart for Yingzhou.
Emerging from the cycle of birth and death, without coming or going,
They wander the pure gardens of Langyuan.

Eight *Man Ting Fang*

Thirty years between,
How many times favored, how many times humbled?
Reflecting on past affairs, weary of speech.
Once I let my hair grow long,
Once I received the emperor’s summons.
Today, I dwell in a mountain village,
Yet someday I shall depart, high-reclining amidst clouds and mist.
Hidden in the grotto-heaven,
Beside the pine peaks,
Preserving life is the cultivation of immortality.

Without transgression,
Perfecting virtue,
Naturally attaining principle,
Refining mercury, cooking lead.
Before merit is complete and conduct perfected,
Leisurely facing the woods and springs.
True joy—zither and books for companions,
Forgetting the dusty world, escaping its torments.
How carefree!
Shedding the form to truly depart,
Ascending into the Great Luo Heaven.

Again—

Encountering the Sevenfold Purification Fast,
On Gengshen days, eating plainly,
Paying homage at dawn and dusk, burning incense.
Constantly mindful of the Dao,
The world’s dream is suddenly forgotten.
The Three Teachings’ scriptures as companions,
In true leisure—better than greedy busyness.
Deluded clouds disperse,
A single wheel of bright moon,
Flawless, illuminating all directions.

In perpetuity,
Illumine the great Dao,
Secretly accumulate deeds,
Ascending to reach the vault of heaven.
Emulating Xu and Pang, departing,
Their names resound through ten thousand ages.
Not yet gone to Penglai or Langyuan,
In a bamboo pavilion, seated,
Laughing and reciting in seclusion.
When merit is complete and one departs,
Even the lords of the underworld cannot summon them,
Riding a crane to the immortal realm.

Again—

This life’s glory,
The merit of past lives,
Awakening to better true cultivation.
Outer joys not yet exhausted,
Thoughts stir, the mind fills with sorrow.
The joy of the plain and ordinary Dao,
In a bamboo pavilion, seated,
Diligently seeking the supreme principle.
Truly enlightened,
The azure sky gleams pure,
Life shines like new autumn.

Enough!
Honor virtue,
Govern with purity and integrity,
Responding to change with perfect completeness.
Awaiting merit’s completion and fame’s fulfillment,
Wandering amidst rosy clouds.
Zither, sword, and immortal scriptures as companions,
Shedding the form to truly ascend,
Rising above the clouds.
Like Pang and Xu,
The whole household is delivered,
Dwelling forever in Yingzhou.

Xu the True Lord’s entire household ascended to heaven,
Pang the Layman’s entire household sat in liberation and departed.

Again—

□□sins exhausted,

□□gazing,
□□distinguishing right,

□distinction.

Without ever filing petitions,
The blessings come as natural coin.
No need to perform rites or mobilize the crowd—
A grain of hemp or wheat suffices,
Nourishing the numinous fields.
Not sought from without,
Creation arises from the void,
Its wondrous subtlety ineffable.

The Dao transmitted—
Illuminating the *Yi*’s images,
Reversing the radiance’s course,
Before heaven and earth.
Awakening: formless yet responding to things,
Beyond the chatter of center or edge.
Pure and still, golden infant and jade maiden,
Within the void, mercury congeals with numinous lead.
Six *zhu* draped,
Returning to the Great Veil,
Once more receiving the Jade Emperor’s decree.

Again—

Body clad in cloud-robes,
Form like plain cloth,
One must not disdain pure poverty.
The Dao has no form or image,
Great awakening reveals the truth within.
Hatred and love—no virtue in either,
All praise and submission are good causes.
Vast fortune arrives,
Leisurely observing the Dharma-teachings,
Pines and bamboo ever as neighbors.

True kin—
Preserving life and nature,
Illuminating past and present,
Merging with the world, dust forgotten.
If one follows my constant goodness,
Eternal escape from sinking and drowning.
The Peng Isle’s immortal realm lies close,
Shedding form to reveal the true spirit.
Beyond the azure skies,
In the Great Veil’s heavens,
The flawless treasure-light renewed.

Again—

chunks.original_text: 万恶心除，千思意泯，自然罪病消亡。 寸灵念道，动静两俱忘。 清志如庞似许，任云水、到处为乡。 仙家好，茅斋幽阒，胜似住高堂。 无忙。 看古教，顿明至理，上运三光。 也不须昼夜，数墨寻行。 养就真铅真汞，蜕形去、天地难量。 碧霄外，大罗归去，重礼马丹阳。 神光灿(声声慢)三首 处玄稽首，库使尊官，一别又过三年。 渴仰之怀路遥，未及人专。 辛酉孟秋仍热，遣来人、复去昼传。 询动静，知丰衍职任，不久将迁。 他日功成厌世，效渊明乐道，闲伴林泉。 自在无拘笑吟，洞外松前。 养就真铅真汞，恁时节、功了三千。 朝元去，现真形独步云轩。 又 处玄拜上，道录高功，日照别后难逢。 渴仰之怀甚时，得睹仙容。 即辰仲冬辛酉，急焚香、跪领开封。 清河德，又行缘阐醮，敬信无穷。 光徧十方真了，去大罗朝圣，升入高穹。 体挂云裳万里，要到乘风。 这番出离生灭，任往来、跨虎骑龙。 天地外，想古今几个真同。 又 处玄稽首，月帔张唐二公，别后思量。 倏忽年余迩闻，却住天长。 常记讲师静位，说关西、作醮歧阳。 香花引，那郝公见道，大哂重阳。 便继处玄乱道，酹江月一句，寸念难忘。 踏尽铁鞋难觅，恍惚灵光。 自然无中妙有，道希夷、无物包藏。 功成去，上大罗天赐玎珰。 酹江月(念奴娇)五首 古今贩骨，想生来死去，荣枯多少。 百载光阴四序逼，不觉形容衰老。 世伪浮华，转头如梦，到底成虚矫。 无生一念，念道真明达了。 最好福地清居，依山临水，自在携笻到。 占得真欢霞洞隐，无事闲看圣教。 功行周圆，完全性命，胜似重修醮。 炼成道体，别有金书来诏。 又 陇西余虑，到潍阳秦台，空来空去。 贵府推官同太守，相访临归叮嘱。 壬戍新正，欲邀到府，未见先生许。 处玄重答，这裹元宵亦做。 四序孰悟三元，天官赐福，下救阴灵苦。 生在中华崇道德，世赞名传千古。 大醮洪禧，青词奏圣，感应应难遇。 文山作醮，白龟莲衬王祖。 又 寿过彭祖，更官高一品，石崇贵富。 古往今来人世事，觉了不堪重虑。 归去渊明，乘舟范蠡，先已超升去。 真通道德，趖却死沉阴路。 云步阆苑蓬山，仙乡不夜，各有逍遥所。 过了天元无上道，千载难逢难遇。 石火光阴，浮沤生灭，飞走乌随兔。 速修性命，暗有贤圣提汝。 又 碧轩阒坐，顿忘言、闲了诗书千卷。 松径携笻真念道，妙奥天机深远。 物外人间，京华云洞，慧眼开时见。 有无俱泯，吟笑浮生不辩。 拔宅庞许飞升，大罗归去，贩骨死生免。 不夜仙乡无苦恼，阆苑瑶池清宴。 海变松枯，亘容弗老，世伪真无羡。 六铢衣挂，复去朝元重现。 又 厌居人世，似孤云飘逸，鹤升霄汉。 自在无拘空外去，撒手直超彼岸。 到处为家，琴书为伴，信笔闲吟叹。 洞天高卧，任他人笑懒慢。 夏近百尺森松，水帘响喨，飞入龙泉涧。 渴饮霞浆仙会处，童稚唇歌舌诞。 趖了轮回，完全性命，迷者应难赴。 忘名绝利，一任人非人赞。 水龙吟 此时辛酉初冬，下元望夜逢甘雨。 麦苗滋长，深根固蒂，多欢少虑。 念道无灾祸，圣贤佑、众生无苦遇。 天元将末，群仙庆会，功全行， 朝元去。 别有天宫宝所，了真修、得升云路。 六铢衣挂，清平福救， 九玄七祖。 归去无生老，自然性、明今达古。

Myriad evils—heart extinguished,
A thousand thoughts—mind dissolved,
Naturally, sins and afflictions vanish.
A thread of spirit clings to the Dao,
Movement and stillness both forgotten.
Pure will like Pang’s or Xu’s,
Wandering clouds and waters—everywhere home.
The immortals’ joy:
A thatched hut in quiet seclusion,
Far surpassing grand halls.

No haste.
Contemplate the ancient teachings,
Suddenly grasp the supreme truth,
Ascend to the Three Luminaries.
No need for day or night,
Counting lines of ink in search.
Nurtured true lead, true mercury,
Shedding form—beyond heaven and earth’s measure.
Beyond azure skies,
Returning to the Great Veil,
Once more bowing to Ma Danyang.

---

*Divine Light Radiant (Shengsheng Man)* Three Poems

Chu Xuan bows deeply,
To the esteemed Libationer,
Three years since our parting.
Longing and reverence—paths too distant,
No messenger could suffice.
In the heat of early autumn, Xin-You,
A visitor sent, then swiftly departed.
I inquired of your state—
Learned of your flourishing duties,
Soon to be promoted.

One day, world-weary with merit fulfilled,
You’ll follow Yuanming’s joy in the Dao,
Companion to forests and springs.
Unfettered, laughing and chanting,
Before the pines beyond the cave.
Nurtured true lead, true mercury,
When the time comes—three thousand merits complete.
Ascend to the Origin,
Revealing your true form, strolling the cloud pavilion alone.

---

Chu Xuan bows again,
To the High Merit of the Dao Register,
Since our parting under the sun, rare to meet.
Longing and reverence—when shall I
Behold the immortal’s countenance?
In the mid-winter of Xin-You,
I hastily lit incense, knelt to receive your opened letter.
Virtue of the Clear River,
Your karmic threads unfold in rites,
Devotion boundless.

Light pervades the ten directions—truly perfected,
Departing to the Great Veil, paying homage to the Sage,
Ascending into the high vault.
Body draped in cloud-robes for ten thousand miles,
Intent on riding the wind.
This time, liberated from birth and death,
Free to come and go—straddling tigers, riding dragons.
Beyond heaven and earth,
How many through the ages have truly walked this path?

---

Chu Xuan bows deeply,
To the Moon-Veiled Lords Zhang and Tang,
Since our parting, my thoughts linger.
Suddenly, over a year has passed—
I hear you now dwell in Tianchang.
I recall the serene seat of the Dharma-teacher,
Speaking of rites in Guanzhong, at Qiyang.
Incense and flowers led the way,
Where Lord Hao, perceiving the Dao,
Greatly laughed at Chongyang.

Then I, Chu Xuan, recklessly spoke,
Pouring a verse to the River Moon,
A single thought unforgotten.
Worn iron sandals in vain search,
In the dim radiance of the spirit.
Naturally, the wondrous exists within nothingness,
The Dao’s mystery—emptiness enfolding all things.
With merit complete, depart,
Ascend to the Great Veil’s heavens,
Awarded the celestial jade chime.

---

*Pouring the River Moon (Nian Nu Jiao)* Five Poems

From ancient times to now, trading bones,
Contemplating life, death, rise, and fall—
How many?
A hundred years of light, four seasons pressing,
Unnoticed, the form ages.
Worldly falsity, fleeting glory,
A turn of the head like a dream,
All ends in vanity.
One thought of non-birth,
Clinging to the Dao—truly enlightened.

Best to dwell in blessed lands,
By mountains, beside waters,
Freely wandering with staff in hand.
Securing true joy, hidden in rosy caves,
Leisurely perusing the sacred teachings.
Merits and deeds complete,
Life and nature perfected,
Surpassing repeated rites.
Refining the Dao-body,
A golden edict arrives from on high.

---

My cares from Longxi,
To Weiyang’s Qin Terrace,
Coming and going in vain.
The esteemed Prefect and Magistrate,
Visiting before departure, urging me.
In the new year of Ren-Xu,
They wished to invite me to the prefecture,
Yet the Master did not consent.
Chu Xuan replied,
Here, too, the Lantern Festival is celebrated.

Who awakens to the Three Origins in the four seasons?
Heavenly officials bestow blessings,
Descending to relieve the suffering of yin spirits.
Born in the Central Land, revering virtue,
The world praises, names echo through the ages.
Grand rites of vast fortune,
Blue petitions presented to the Sage,
Responses rarely met.
Wenshan’s rites,
White turtle, lotus—supporting Ancestor Wang.

---

Living past Pengzu,
Holding rank above the first grade,
As rich as Shi Chong.
From ancient times to now, worldly affairs—
Realizing their weightlessness.
Retiring like Yuanming,
Sailing like Fan Li,
Already transcended.
Truly mastering the Dao,
Escaping the dark paths of death.

Cloud-steps to Penglai, Langyuan,
Immortal lands never night,
Each has its carefree abode.
Beyond the Celestial Origin’s supreme Dao,
A thousand years—hard to encounter.
The spark of life’s light,
Foam’s birth and death,
Flying crows following the hare.
Swiftly cultivate life and nature,
Wise sages secretly guide you.

---

Sitting in the azure pavilion’s quiet,
Suddenly forgetting words,
Leisurely perusing a thousand scrolls of poetry and books.
Pine path, staff in hand, truly clinging to the Dao,
Profound, the celestial mechanism’s depth.
Beyond the world, within the mortal realm,
Capital’s clouds, cave’s radiance,
When the wisdom-eye opens—seen.
Existence and non-existence both dissolved,
Laughing and chanting, floating life unjudged.

The households of Pang and Xu ascend,
Returning to the Great Veil,
Escaping the trade of bones, life and death.
Immortal lands never night—no suffering,
Langyuan’s jade pools, pure feasts.
Seas turn to withered pines,
Eternal youth—no aging,
Worldly falsity—no envy.
Six-spun robes draped,
Again ascending to the Origin, revealed anew.

---

Weary of dwelling in the mortal world,
Like a lone cloud drifting,
A crane soaring to the heavens.
Unfettered, unbound, beyond the void,
Letting go—directly transcending the other shore.
Everywhere home,
Zither and books as companions,
Freely writing, chanting sighs.
Reclining in the grotto-heaven,
Let others mock my laziness.

Summer nears—hundred-foot pines tower,
Water curtains roar,
Flying into the Dragon Spring Gorge.
Thirst quenched with rosy nectar at immortal gatherings,
Youths singing, lips and tongues loose.
Escaping the wheel of rebirth,
Life and nature perfected,
The deluded struggle to follow.
Forsaking fame, renouncing profit,
Let others praise or blame at will.

---

*Water Dragon Chant*

This early winter of Xin-You,
On the full moon of the Lower Origin,
Sweet rain arrives.
Wheat sprouts flourish,
Roots deep, stems firm,
More joy, fewer cares.
Clinging to the Dao—no disasters,
Sages protect—no suffering for beings.
The Celestial Origin nears its end,
Immortals celebrate in assembly,
Merits complete—
Ascend to the Origin.

Beyond lies the celestial palace’s treasure,
Perfected true cultivation—
Ascending the cloud path.
Six-spun robes draped,
Pure peace, blessings bestowed,
Nine ancestors, seven generations.
Returning—no aging or death,
Naturally, life and nature—
Illuminating past and present.

chunks.original_text: 各全家奉道始终，莫变管如庞许。 满路花 霜林飘赤叶，徧地涌黄金。 宾鸿离塞北，足声音。 渊明归去， 独酌乐清吟。 酩酊真欢笑，高卧云山，忘尘世，伪难侵。 顿然觉，应物无心。 道妙自然深。 壶中仙景异，外休寻。 四时花放，论古更明今。 要到乘风去，三岛十洲，蓬莱别有高岑。 行香子二首 历徧人间，却羡名山。 洞天清、坐听潺湲。 万株松桧，千顷云烟。 好伴琴书，真念道，乐安闲。 养就灵铅，命耀光圆。 行功成、蓬岛为仙。 出离生灭，万古相传。 既兔轮回，六铢挂，去朝元。 又 金鼎生光，常爇真香。 宝瓶花、四序芬芳。 虚空贤圣，咫尺西方。 上敬三清，明三耀，悟三皇。 上古人淳，厚实佳祥。 性通天、与道无妨。 暗行平等，柔胜刚强。 意似仙真，全仙行，往仙乡。 山亭柳 退道者堕，进道者升 退道愚生，意乱心生。 丧命尽贪生。 不畏神明察日，千愆万过迷生。 死堕酆都苦苦，苦尽傍生。 进道清真忘世梦，闲看圣教似书生。 达理悟修生。 气结神灵异，自然有、霞彩光生。 宝鉴碧霄晃耀，真个先生。 蓦山溪六首 七旬相近，正好忘尘世。 世梦几时休，道德修、胜争薄利。 恩山爱海，火院镇烧身，闻身健，觅清凉，一任迷人毁。 闲看三教，造化明周易。 达理妙通天，四相泯、无忧无喜。 洞天高卧，自在炼真丹，他年去，上青霄，始现无为异。 又 人间华丽，恰似风前烛。 万事转头空，世外隐、仙家清福。 灵峰霞洞，四序不知秋，松为伴，竹为邻，闲唱无生曲。 琴书乐性，道用调金木。 炼出九霄身，六铢挂、朝元去速。 永无生老，升入大罗天，任巨海，变桑田，真与神仙逐。 又 人间万事，识破真归笑。 恩爱与尘情，譬无常、般般是了。 浮沤幻体，生灭几时休，忘世梦，去贪争，违道真明晓。 微光觉照，应变通深妙。 命住性通天，有自然、无穷降耀。 阳纯阴尽，蜕壳兔沉沦，游阆苑，玩瑶池，玉帝金书诏。 又 玉峰顶上，知有田三段。
chunks.translated_text:
**Households Devoted to the Dao**

Let every household uphold the Dao from beginning to end,
Unchanging as the steadfast Peng and Xu.

*Flowers Along the Path*
Frost-kissed forests scatter crimson leaves,
Golden wheat surges across the land.
Wild geese depart the northern frontier,
Their cries echoing in flight.
Like Yuanming, I return home,
Sipping wine in joyful solitude.
Drunk on true delight, I laugh aloud,
Reclining high in cloud-wrapped mountains,
Forgetting the dusty world—
Falsehoods cannot touch me.
Suddenly awakened,
I respond to things with no mind.
The Dao’s mystery runs deep by nature.
Within the gourd, immortal scenes differ—
Seek no more without.
Flowers bloom in all four seasons,
Discussing the past to illumine the present.
One day, riding the wind, I shall depart
To the Three Isles and Ten Continents,
Where Penglai’s peaks rise anew.

*Two Lyrics to "Fragrant Journey"*

I have wandered the human realm,
Yet now I envy the sacred mountains.
In cave-heavens so pure, I sit and listen
To the murmuring streams.
Ten thousand pines and cypresses,
A thousand acres of mist and clouds—
Fine companions for my zither and books.
Truly devoted to the Dao,
I delight in tranquility.

Having refined the numinous lead,
My life’s radiance shines round.
When merit is complete,
I shall become an immortal of Penglai Isle,
Transcending birth and death,
Eternally remembered.
Freed from the wheel of rebirth,
Robed in six-spun silk,
I ascend to the Origin.

Again—
The golden tripod glows,
Ever burning true incense.
Precious vases bloom with flowers
Fragrant through all four seasons.
Saints and sages of the void
Dwell as near as the western paradise.
I revere the Three Pure Ones,
Illumine the Three Luminaries,
And awaken to the Three Sovereigns.

In ancient times, people were simple,
Honest and blessed with good fortune.
Their nature connected to heaven,
Unobstructed by the Dao.
They practiced equality in secret,
Softness overcoming hardness.
Their minds like those of immortals,
Their conduct wholly immortal—
They journeyed to the immortal realm.

*Willow by the Mountain Pavilion*

Those who retreat from the Dao fall,
Those who advance in the Dao rise.
Retreating is folly—
The mind wanders, the heart stirs,
Life is lost to endless greed.
Unafraid of divine scrutiny,
A thousand faults, ten thousand errors
Bewilder the living.
In death, they plunge into Fengdu’s torments,
Suffering without end, reborn among beasts.

Those who advance in the Dao,
Pure and true, forget the world’s illusions,
Leisurely studying sacred teachings like scholars.
Comprehending principles, they awaken to cultivation.
Qi congeals, the spirit becomes wondrous,
Naturally, rosy clouds and radiant light arise.
The precious mirror gleams in the azure sky—
Truly, they become immortals.

*Six Lyrics to "Crossing the Mountain Brook"*

Nearly seventy years old,
The time is ripe to forget the dusty world.
How long will this dream of life last?
Cultivating virtue surpasses
Striving for meager gains.
Mountains of kindness, seas of love—
The fiery household burns the body.
Hearing of health, I seek coolness,
Letting deluded people slander as they will.

Leisurely observing the Three Teachings,
I understand the transformations of the *Zhouyi*.
Comprehending principles, I connect with heaven’s mysteries,
The four forms dissolved—
No sorrow, no joy.
In cave-heavens, I recline at ease,
Refining the true elixir.
One day, I shall ascend the azure sky,
Revealing the marvels of non-action.

Again—
The splendor of the human world
Is like a candle in the wind.
All things turn to emptiness in the end—
Beyond the world, recluses enjoy
The pure blessings of immortals.
In misty peaks and grottoes,
Unaware of autumn through the four seasons,
Pines as companions, bamboo as neighbors,
I idly sing the song of no-birth.

Zither and books bring joy to my nature,
The Dao’s function harmonizes metal and wood.
Refining a body for the nine heavens,
Robed in six-spun silk,
I swiftly ascend to the Origin.
Forever free from aging and death,
I rise into the Great Brahma Heaven,
As the vast sea turns to mulberry fields—
Truly, I follow the divine immortals.

Again—
All worldly affairs,
Seen through, bring only laughter.
Love and worldly attachments,
Like impermanence itself,
Are all exhausted in time.
This floating bubble of a body—
When will its birth and death cease?
Forgetting the world’s illusions,
Abandoning greed and strife,
I depart from the Dao, truly enlightened.

Subtle light awakens and illumines,
Responding with profound subtlety.
Life abides, nature connects to heaven,
Naturally bestowing boundless radiance.
Yang pure, yin exhausted,
I shed my shell, freed from sinking.
Roaming the Jasper Pool,
Playing in the Jade Pond,
The Jade Emperor’s golden decree summons me.

Again—
Atop the Jade Peak,
I know there are three plots of land.

chunks.original_text: 壬润长黄芽，便万斛、珠酬弗换。 一麻一麦，服了自然安，修性命，体延年，别近云霞伴。 阴阳之外，天地难拘管。 得道免轮回，厌世隐，神堂古观。 无为功行，真了去朝元，六铢挂，现真形，三岛十洲玩。 又 红莲池畔，不让游山景。 闹裹却无心，身似藕、出泥花静。 壶天妙趣，别有四时春，真应物，宝光明，今古谁人省。 真行道德，显化邪归正。 口应更声随，只是要、寸灵无病。 贪争意尽，道眼自然开，来世外，混京华，积行常平等。 又 王徐道友，今日重相别。 甚日再相逢，到来岁、新秋重歇， 一年一到，百载几番来，且暂坐，意休忙，乌兔生还灭。 人间宠辱，辱似圆光缺。 少喜虑多忧，想僧爱、是非慵说。 天元将尽，奉劝速修真，游洞府，隐松峰，无事看庄列。 玉堂春二首 道德清平，贤者真易化。 世梦知空，几人放下。 厌浊清居， 周天运爻卦。 身是行庵到处家。 养就圆光，碧虚无执， 把万里清澄、自然悬挂。 物外逍遥，潇潇真脱洒。 悟者超升学者麻。 又 仙观灵虚，二年来来去。 破了重修，星冠养素。 应有真无， 斋科救万苦。 达理忘言清静居。 道释儒宽，通为三教， 户外应五常，敬谦贤许。 四相心无，自然乐有余。 出了阴阳现亘初。 踏云行(踏莎行)九首 时辛酉岁仲冬十有二日，经过大原宅，清旦门外忽观东南彩霞。 信笔。 遥望东南，彩光分朗。
chunks.translated_text:
As the Ren-water nourishes the golden sprout,
Ten thousand bushels of pearls cannot compare.
One grain of hemp, one grain of wheat—
Consumed, they bring natural peace.
Cultivating life and nature,
The body endures, years extend,
Drawing near to cloud-and-mist companions.
Beyond yin and yang,
Heaven and earth cannot constrain.
Attaining the Dao, I escape rebirth,
Weary of the world, I retreat—
To ancient temples in sacred halls.
Through effortless merit and practice,
Truly perfected, I ascend to the Origin.
Six *zhu* of silk draped,
My true form appears,
Roaming the Three Isles and Ten Continents.

Again—
By the Red Lotus Pool,
No mountain scenery can rival this.
Amidst the bustle, yet untroubled in heart,
The body like a lotus—
Emerging from mud, its blossom serene.
The wondrous realm of the Gourd Heaven,
Holds a spring eternal through all four seasons.
Truly responsive to things,
Radiant with jewel-like light—
Who through the ages has understood?
With true practice of virtue and power,
Manifesting transformation, evil returns to right.
Words adapt, voices follow,
Only to keep the inch of spirit free from illness.
Greed and strife exhausted,
The Dao-eye opens naturally.
Beyond this world,
Merging with the imperial capital,
Accumulating deeds of constant equality.

Again—
Friend Wang Xu,
Today we part once more.
When shall we meet again?
Perhaps next year,
When autumn returns anew.
Once a year we gather,
How many times in a hundred years?
For now, sit awhile,
Let the mind rest from haste—
Sun and moon rise and set.
Worldly honor and disgrace,
Disgrace like the moon’s waning light.
Little joy, much worry,
Thinking of love and attachment,
Weary of speaking of right and wrong.
As the Heavenly Origin nears its end,
I urge you—hasten to cultivate the true.
Roam the grotto heavens,
Dwell in pine-clad peaks,
At ease, peruse the *Zhuangzi* and *Liezi*.

**Jade Hall Spring (Two Poems)**

Virtue and power, pure and level,
The worthy are truly easy to transform.
Worldly dreams seen as empty—
How many let go?
Weary of filth, dwelling in clarity,
The celestial cycle turns through hexagrams.
The body is a wandering hermitage,
A home wherever it goes.
Nurturing the perfect radiance,
Azure emptiness, no clinging—
Hanging naturally, a thousand miles of limpid clarity.
Beyond things, carefree,
Unfettered, truly at ease.
The awakened transcend,
While learners remain entangled.

Again—
In the immortal’s temple, numinous and void,
For two years, coming and going.
Broken, then rebuilt,
The star-crown nurtures simplicity.
Responding with true non-being,
Fasting and rituals relieve ten thousand sufferings.
Understanding principle, forgetting words,
Dwelling in stillness.
Dao, Buddha, Confucian—vast,
Together as the Three Teachings,
Beyond the door, the Five Constants:
Reverence, humility, worthiness, and trust.
Free from the four marks of the mind,
Naturally, joy abounds.
Beyond yin and yang,
The primordial appears.

**Treading Clouds (Nine Poems of Treading the Sedge)**

On the twelfth day of mid-winter, in the year *xinyou*,
Passing through the Great Origin Residence,
At dawn’s gate, I suddenly beheld
Southeastern rosy clouds.
Freely brushed—

Gazing afar to the southeast,
Brilliant hues divide the radiance.

chunks.translated_text:
Suddenly, I saw the path to Binzhou.
Through jiao rites, resonance calls upon the lofty perfected,
For in years past, there was the noble Liu.
Virtue fills the ten directions, saving boundless beings.
Myriad purities, myriad virtues—principles vast and profound.

One day, returning to Penglai,
The wondrous Dao of non-action holds no falsehood.

---

Seventy years of light,
Fifty-two myriad.
Guard against the unforeseen, the limitless impermanence.
Cast aside this borrowed form, descend to yellow springs—
Through life’s changes, time’s praises resound.

Suddenly awakened to the numinous peak,
Truly transcending the other shore.
Shedding form, ascending to the cloudy Han,
Once the celestial origin is passed, there is no return.
The treaders of sedge—none can catch them.

---

The sagely Dao is rare to meet,
Yet true cultivation is easily encountered.
The natural principle illumines past and present.
Death and life trade bones a thousand times,
But this time, fully realized—no coming, no going.

In Penglai’s immortal land,
Primordial numinosity knows no suffering.
On the road to audience with the origin, the lofty perfected approve.
Pines wither, seas shift—yet this endures forever.
In years to come, ten thousand ancestors escape the yin府.

---

Mother and child reunite,
Naturally enlightened to the Dao.
Emerging from the shell of things, free from birth and old age.
Thatched hut, pines, and bamboo ever as neighbors.

**Treading Clouds (Nine Poems of Treading the Sedge)**

On the twelfth day of mid-winter, in the year *xinyou*,
Passing through the Great Origin Residence,
At dawn’s gate, I suddenly beheld
Southeastern rosy clouds.
Freely brushed—

Gazing afar to the southeast,
Brilliant hues divide the radiance.

chunks.translated_text:
In tranquil seclusion, the immortal’s home is fine.
Reverent faith in the lofty and bright—
True joy knows no vexation.
Each must cultivate life and destiny early.
When merit is complete and conduct fulfilled, escape the wheel of rebirth,
Shedding form to ride the crane back to Penglai.

---

Last year at Zhou Pavilion,
This year I return again.
Time flies like an arrow, hastening man’s old age.
Seeing through worldly emptiness, best to rest the heart—
Begin cultivation early, with resolve.

Unwilling to forget attachments,
Regret and remorse will follow.
On Pine Peak, delight in the Dao, content with fate’s provisions.
From nothingness refine mercury and lead,
Then ride the clouds and crane back to Penglai.

---

Children and gold shackles,
Love’s jade fetters—
A fiery pit, a prison cell, the body like a convict.
Bewildered, one becomes like a spring silkworm,
Swiftly break free, guard the void within.

Day and night in haste,
Crow flies, hare runs—
Floating bubbles arise and perish, form cannot endure.
Hasten to cultivate life and destiny, escape the wheel of rebirth,
Perfect merit and conduct to befriend Penglai’s immortals.

---

Disordered by dregs and wine,
Nourished by jade nectar—
Do not be deluded by existence; seek in non-existence.
From the twelve-tiered tower gaze toward Penglai,
chunks.overlap_context:
a thousand times,
But this time, fully realized—no coming, no going.

In Penglai’s immortal land,
Primordial numinosity knows no suffering.
On the road to audience with the origin, the lofty perfected approve.
Pines wither, seas shift—yet this endures forever.
In years to come, ten thousand ancestors escape the yin府.

---

Mother and child reunite,
Naturally enlightened to the Dao.
Emerging from the shell of things, free from birth and old age.
Thatched hut, pines, and bamboo ever as neighbors.

chunks.original_text: 慧眸明处光无极。 真乐陶陶，洞天游历。 道灵今古几人识。 担云信步入丹霄，大罗归去无为职。 又 到处为家，鹑居无恋。 要行便去云游转。 阴阳之外物难拘， 长安咫尺真非远。 道乐希夷，死生永兔。 亘初一点光如电。 自然照耀晃虚无，命清无缺成修炼。 又 一别三年，重游此地。 云庵寂阒忘心意。 有时忻则看仙经， 自然理达真明异。 真乐希夷，道尊德贵。 俱捐无有忘忧喜。 洞天清隐混嚣尘，要登云路先超彼。 惜黄花三首 众生万过，有天来大。 觉世梦知空，莫争人我。 应变爱憎，无竞无灾祸。 眼前事，顿明识破。 敬道修因果，颠猿紧锁。 得自然真慧，住行坐卧。 达理了，仙经物外灵无堕。 隐洞天，古今几个。 又 天元将尽，去年卦尽。 这世梦冤亲，何时是尽。 三寸不来休，却变骷髅尽。 到如斯，俗念心尽。 道灵真无尽，忘机业尽。 觉万慧千通，顿然明尽。 外貌似憨痴，吟笑风灯尽。 乐无极，任他物尽。 又
chunks.translated_text:
Where wisdom’s gaze shines bright, light knows no bounds.
True joy abounds, roaming through grotto-heavens.
How many through the ages have known the Dao’s mystery?
Shouldering clouds, strolling into cinnabar skies,
Returning to the Great Canopy, the office of non-action.

---

Wherever one dwells is home, like the quail’s nest unattached.
Ready to depart, one wanders the clouds at will.
Beyond yin and yang, things cannot constrain;
Chang’an is but a footstep away, not truly distant.
The Dao’s joy lies in the subtle and serene, beyond life and death.
From the primal origin, a single gleam flashes like lightning,
Naturally illuminating the void,
With life pure and flawless, cultivation is complete.

---

Three years since parting, returning to this place,
The cloud hermitage is still, the heart’s intent forgotten.
At times, delighting in the perusal of immortal scriptures,
Naturally, principles are grasped, true clarity attained.
True joy lies in the subtle and serene; the Dao is revered, virtue noble.
All is relinquished, nothingness embraced, joy and sorrow forgotten.
In the secluded grotto-heaven, the clamor of the world is merged,
To ascend the cloud-path, first transcend this.

---

*Three Poems Lamenting the Yellow Flowers*

Countless are the transgressions of sentient beings,
Vast as the heavens.
Awaken to the world as a dream, know its emptiness,
Do not contend over self and others.
Adapt to love and hate, without strife, without calamity.
In matters before the eyes, suddenly see through and understand.
Revere the Dao, cultivate cause and effect,
Tightly bind the monkey of the mind.
Attain the natural true wisdom,
In walking, standing, sitting, and lying.
Comprehending principles, enlightened,
The immortal scriptures transcend the mundane, never falling.
Hidden in grotto-heavens,
How many have there been through the ages?

---

The celestial epoch nears its end, last year’s hexagrams exhausted.
In this worldly dream, karmic ties—when will they cease?
When the three inches of breath no longer come, all turn to bare skulls.
At such a time, worldly thoughts and the heart are extinguished.
The Dao’s spirit is truly inexhaustible, worldly karma forgotten.
Awakening to myriad wisdoms and thousandfold insights,
Suddenly all is clear.
Outwardly appearing foolish and dull,
Chanting and laughing like a wind-blown lamp.
Joy knows no bounds,
Let all things come to their end.

chunks.original_text: 大翁出去，随家店住。 且只似昔年，混俗庞许。 食肉爱生灵，饮酒休乱做。 肯忘贪，闲论今古。 仙家乐处，逍遥云路。 隐世外修性，金乌随兔。 行就访蓬山，功了离尘所。 蜕凡形，礼丹阳父。 青杏儿三首 九月季秋凉。 谢尊官、重献霞浆。 难当厚礼重重爱，世中名利，贪争俗虑，身坐心忙。 道化怕无常。 三十年、总敬丹阳。 东莱满郡无疑妄，天元庆会，这番归去，朝现天皇。 又 念道玉浆多。 得真欢、大笑呵呵。 自然酩酊逍遥快，依山临水，云霞洞外，忻后高歌。 世景急如梭。 恋恩山、洒洒波波。 若肯回头归真一，烹铅炼汞，功成行满，升入烟罗。 又 迷者似河沙。
chunks.translated_text:
The Great Elder departs,
Lodging at a common inn.
Just as in former years,
Like Pang and Xu, blending with the world.
Eating meat, yet cherishing living beings;
Drinking wine, but never to excess.
Willing to forget greed,
Casually discussing past and present.
The joy of the immortals’ realm,
Roaming freely on cloud paths.
Cultivating nature beyond the world,
As the golden crow follows the jade hare.
Walking to visit Penglai Mountain,
Once the work is done, leaving the dusty realm.
Shedding the mortal form,
Paying homage to Father Danyang.

*Three Green Apricot Songs*

In the ninth month, autumn’s chill descends.
Grateful to the noble lord,
Who again offers the nectar of clouds.
Hard to bear such profound gifts and boundless kindness—
In this world, fame and profit,
Greed and strife, worldly cares,
Leave the body seated but the heart restless.
The Dao’s transformation fears impermanence.
For thirty years,
All reverence to Danyang.
In Donglai, the entire prefecture harbors no falsehoods.
The celestial epoch celebrates this gathering.
This time, returning,
One appears before the Heavenly Emperor.

---

Thinking of the Jade Nectar of the Dao,
Attaining true joy,
Laughing heartily, haha!
Naturally drunk, carefree and blissful,
By mountains and waters,
Beyond the cloud-grottoes,
Singing with delight afterward.
The world’s scenes rush by like a shuttle.
Clinging to Mount Grace,
Waves upon waves.
If one turns back to return to the True One,
Refining lead and mercury,
Once the work is complete and merit fulfilled,
Ascending into the misty heavens.

---

The deluded are like river sands.

chunks.original_text: 想世间、学者如麻。 万中敬信无一悟，观今视古，浮生浊梦，个个都差。 达了莫矜夸。 访洞天、闲卧烟霞。 他年归去方知得，瑶台阆苑，神仙乐处，四序仙花。 武陵春二首 遥望岗山山正好，莹莹正芬芳。 佳节春温春昼长，最好泛霞浆。 酩酊歌欢忘世虑，昤笑胜轻狂。 来往仙乡住道乡，过此庆重阳。 又 辛酉仲春游坎上，终日坐春园。 异景奇葩在目前，树下胜筠轩。 世梦知空且放下，自在似真仙。 美酝开樽会众贤，乐道谢高天。 感皇恩二首 道释与儒门，真通法海。 易妙阴阳外，自然解。 金刚至理，顿觉无争泯爱。 五千玄言奥，夷明大。 微光运转，结成雯盖。 霞辉常照体，何挂碍。 松枯石烂，亘貌古今真在。 他年功行满，升仙界。 又 圣观号天长，星冠云服。 养成金玉体，真无朽。 信知大道，自然无中明有。 世华心不恋，游王屋。 外贫保命，隐真居陋。 亘初无相貌，胜丰厚。 桑田海变，这个无形坚久。 暗祝吾皇德，齐天寿。 望远行 令子根苗裔，云水通行步。 顿觉了，希夷微妙明千古。 去尘寰历徧，看来都无伴侣。 世人爱不爱，高真许。 达道完性命，永免轮回苦。 隐福地，松峰霞洞自在处。 待养就、金铅玉汞，真无浊虑。 六铢挂，始应过三清举。 定风波四首 临醮诸公戒行清，动天感应福非轻。 壬润琼田农尽喜，秋成。 谷田珠长豆苗生。 要报天恩崇道德，随缘知足莫相争。 日一望焚香餐素膳，无憎。 意平出语似仙经。 又
chunks.translated_text:
Thinking of the world’s scholars, thick as hemp,
Ten thousand revere and believe, yet none awaken.
Gazing now and looking back through time,
This floating life is but a muddled dream—
Each and every one has strayed.
Those who comprehend must not boast or brag.
Seek the grotto-heavens, lie at ease amidst mist and clouds.
Only in the years to come, upon returning, will they know:
The Jasper Terrace and the Park of Lang,
Where immortals dwell in joy,
And four-season immortal blossoms bloom.

*Two Poems on "Spring at Wuling"*

From afar, the hills of Gang Mountain stand just right,
Luminous and fragrant in their splendor.
A fine season, spring’s warmth, spring’s long days—
Best to float upon the nectar of rosy clouds.
Drunken and singing, carefree, forgetting worldly cares,
Laughing and smiling, surpassing reckless abandon.
Coming and going between the land of immortals and the realm of Dao,
Passing through, we celebrate the Double Ninth.

*Again*

In mid-spring of the Xin-You year, wandering to Kan’s heights,
All day seated in the spring garden.
Rare scenes, wondrous blossoms before my eyes,
Beneath the trees, surpassing the bamboo pavilion.
Knowing the world’s dream is empty, I let it go,
At ease, like a true immortal.
Fine wine is poured, the cup shared with worthy companions,
Rejoicing in the Dao, I thank the lofty heavens.

*Two Poems on "Grateful for Imperial Grace"*

Daoism, Buddhism, and the Confucian gate,
Truly penetrate the ocean of dharma.
Beyond the subtleties of *Yi*’s yin and yang,
One naturally understands.
The Diamond’s supreme truth,
Instantly dissolves strife and erases attachment.
The five thousand profound words,
Pacify and illuminate the great.

A faint light revolves,
Weaving into a canopy of clouds.
Rosy radiance ever illumines the body—
What hindrance could there be?
Though pines wither and rocks crumble,
The ancient truth endures unchanged.
When merit and conduct are complete in years to come,
Ascend to the immortal realms.

*Again*

The sacred temple is called "Heaven’s Eternity,"
With starry crown and cloud-woven robes.
Nurturing a body of gold and jade,
Truly imperishable.
Knowing the great Dao,
Naturally reveals being from non-being.
The world’s splendor holds no allure for the heart,
As I wander to Wangwu.
Outwardly poor, preserving life,
Concealing truth in humble abode.
From the beginning, formless and without appearance,
Yet surpassing abundance.
Though mulberry fields turn to seas,
This unshaped one endures.
Silently I pray for our emperor’s virtue,
To match the heavens in longevity.

*Gazing Afar at the Journey*

Your offspring, of noble lineage,
Tread the cloud-wandering path with ease.
Suddenly awakened,
The subtle wonders of the unseen and inaudible are clear through the ages.
Having traversed the dusty world,
I see no companions in all directions.
Whether the world loves or scorns,
The perfected ones permit it.

Having mastered the Dao and fulfilled nature and life,
Forever freed from the suffering of rebirth.
Dwelling in blessed lands,
Amidst pine peaks and cloud grottoes, at ease.
Waiting until gold-lead and jade-mercury are refined,
Truly without turbid cares.
Donning the six *zhu* robe,
Only then will I ascend past the Three Clarities.

*Four Poems on "Calming the Waves"*

Before the ritual, all gentlemen purify their conduct,
Moving heaven, evoking responses—blessings no light matter.
The celestial moisture nourishes jade-like fields, farmers rejoice,
Autumn’s harvest comes.
Grain fields sprout pearls, bean shoots grow.
To repay heaven’s grace, exalt virtue and the Dao,
Follow conditions, be content, and do not contend.
Each day, gaze afar, burn incense, and dine on plain fare,
Without hatred.
A mind at peace, words spoken like a sage’s scripture.

*Again*

chunks.translated_text:
Sweet rain falls in season, precious as oil,
Today’s joy leaves no room for sorrow.
Tomorrow night, singing while plowing the wild fields,
Scold the ox—
A light flick of the whip surpasses all cultivation.

Beyond Heaven’s Origin, deeds are hard to accumulate,
A sesame seed, a grain of wheat—harvested in an inch’s space.
Once the Crimson Infant is nurtured, one ascends beyond the clouds,
At ease—
Life’s radiance round as the autumn moon’s first glow.

Again

Once a month, burn incense, fast at the sun’s gaze,
Observe these precepts to dissolve calamity.
On *jiazi* and *gengshen* days, mark the seventh cycle,
Rejoice—
The spirits of officials and gods arrive in due time.

With body and mind purified, free from sickness and suffering,
Nurture true nature, preserve life, and move through the Three Terraces.
When merit and deeds are complete, where shall one go?
Ah—
Riding clouds, straddling a crane, off to Penglai.

Again

The *gui* door sealed by clouds, the hexagram’s lines in motion,
Pierce open the numinous aperture where tiger and dragon entwine.
From *mao* to *you*, the true vision unfolds,
Lofty Kun—
The Golden Elder spins his thread to hook the jade sea-turtle.

The Dao and virtue clear, the Dharma sea luminous,
Myriad lights manifest, the Nine Heavens high.
Creation moves naturally, the spirit’s workings turn—
Beyond containment.

Nearing middle age,

All things, when turned to look back, are but a single dream,

Life and nature understood,

The chief arrives,
The prefect then extends his invitation.
Bidden to sit within the Hidden Spring Hall,
At whatever hour—dawn or clear morning—
True blessing dissolves through the Dao’s power.

To draw near the rite,
Hasten swift as the wind’s drift.
The Daoist Lingxu divides his portion,
The young disciple joins to tend the burning.
Worthy sages dwell in cinnabar skies.

Again

Form like the crane,
Nature radiant as lone cloud.
Unfettered in the void, without hindrance,
Coming and going, the mind dustless—
Beyond the world, the joy of true immortals.

Great completion bowed,
The three teachings’ principles transcend the crowd.
The elixir-wrought bowels depart for Peng Isle,
The immortal realm holds another grotto spring.
The Dao’s image ever ancient, ever new.

Again

Cultivation fine,
One studies the rites of fasting and transformation.
At dawn and full moon, incense burns to honor the sages,
By day at ease, in quiet night, all chant together.
Wisdom’s nature shines abundantly.

The principle of non-action,
No dharma surpasses its way.
Outer conduct and inner work truly complete,
Lead and mercury refined, one leaves the realm of suffering.
Attaining the Dao, one escapes King Yama.

chunks.original_text: 神山无为应缘长生子刘处玄造 五言绝句颂一百九十首 轮回几万遭，去爱命清逃。 造化无中有，冲和离坎交。 物外逃生死，常如初时志。 通真全妙慧，可称修仙子。 性光命似油，微妙阒中搜。 照见无虚妄，碧天皓月秋。 轮回生死大，觉悟通法海。 举意合真经，混尘明世外。 清通神气灵，上士悟无争。 达理全功行，碧霄云外行。 得道自然真，青莲出垢津。 挂碍心无碍，蜕形身外身。 举意除憎爱，形衰真性在。 顿明道眼开，圣经自然解。 道觉明真趣，慧通达万古。 自然清志坚，性命光圆去。 日用缚颠猿，虚心微妙传。 剔开真道眼，清意见灵仙。 清柔神气灵，浊恶性无明。 悟道超生灭，真归天外行。 善清脱生死，天莹万光明。 真通全妙理，归去踏云行。 正理掩他非，道通霄汉梯。 应缘无挂碍，功了行无亏。 美色悟骷髅，知空意莫留。 顿明性命大，真了洞天游。 到岸了无生，冲和道性灵。 命住圆成了，夷然功行盈。 善觉不争空，忘尘见道功。 微通三宝结，金光射玉峰。 轮回生死大，保命忘世爱。 云水伴松峰，慧灵观自在。 无我微光觉，道成免贩壳。 理明至德全，灵象无中握。 日用六根清，悟真道理明。 自然全万行，归去碧霄行。 他非似已过，谦下真明我。 降火炼金铅，行全无为果。 物尽道真常，夷清至德长。 忘言明妙理，命住结丹光。 德全憎爱尽，天道难询问。 觉了自然通，阳纯云路近。 守道真无罪，迷难悟则易。 天青万象明，升仙免下鬼。 轮回万万遭，见道死生逃。 出了阴阳壳，冲和离坎交。 大悟不争空，至明万事容。 隐仙真厌浊，洞外伴森松。 清真悟死生，保命气神灵。 行通全万善，功了到蓬瀛。 违道履薄冰，爱迷性命沉。 傻猿擒缚住，积行圣贤钦。 轮回生死大，不悟恩生害。 顿觉洞天游，理明通法海。 日用寸无愆，始终仗志坚。 阳纯灵耀灿，无缺十分圆。 无争至德全，道觉妙微传。 应变真明了，蜕形蓬岛仙。 见道性无争，冲和万慧明。 自然全至行，厌世洞天行。 进真入碧虚，退志有酆都。 莫退也休进，游山混世居。 明真一遇仙，日用汞烹铅，达了清平行，道玄天地先。 得道不争空，混尘众垢容。 他年真厌世，洞外伴森松。 清虚志要坚，世外好修仙。 道免轮回苦，真升万古传。 物尽真无死，清通道慧生。 自然明万化，忘世应缘平。 保命通真福，通天开慧目。 明元道宝全，真去朝元速。 灵峰超苦海，觉悟真明解。 得意却忘言，道成天地外。 明知世梦虚，几个出尘居。 达理明天道，真通今古书。 守道悟完颜，自然慧目看。 灵虚真弗朽，清彻古长安。 道觉超生死，顿明明奥旨。 清志有始终，枢机贤圣赐。 忘贪去罪病，达理修性命。 隐道伴松峰，他年朝至圣。 轮回万万遭，明道死生逃。 清命圆无缺，变通运卦爻。 日用觉清通，无争万事容。 真常明至道，归去与仙同。 出尘清志坚，道觉养三田。 长就灵苗了，真光麻麦传。 通微道眼开，真了到蓬莱。 物外超生死，亘灵没地埋。 顿悟乐希夷，枢机泯见知。 天青万象显，祥耀透帘帏。 正理悟清平，自然尽爱憎。 道明全至行，蜕壳现真形。 念道真无罪，新愆不造异。 清通合圣经，保命神超彼。 柔弱气神灵，松峰之下行。 了仙隐福地，达理行功成。 了真清一志，得道超生死。
chunks.translated_text:
**Five-Word Quatrains in Praise**
*Composed by Liu Chuxuan, the Unbound Long-Life Child of the Effortless Divine Mountain*
*One Hundred Ninety Poems*

---

Through countless cycles turned,
From love’s grasp life flees pure.
Creation’s void holds form—
Vital harmony meets the parted stream.

Beyond things, death escaped,
Ever firm as first resolve.
Through truth, perfect wisdom dawns—
One may be called a cultivating immortal.

Nature’s light, life like oil,
Subtle, still—search within.
Illumined, no falsehood seen,
Autumn’s azure sky, moon serene.

The wheel of birth and death vast,
Awakened, one crosses Dharma’s sea.
Intent aligns with true scripture,
Dust merged, the world’s beyond made bright.

Pure, the spirit and qi refined,
The noble one grasps non-contention.
Attaining principle, deeds complete,
Beyond azure clouds one soars.

Attained the Dao, naturally true,
Blue lotus rises from filth’s ford.
Entangled yet the heart unobstructed,
Shedding form, a body beyond body.

Intent raised, love and hate dispelled,
Form fades—true nature remains.
Suddenly the Dao-eye opens,
Sacred scripture naturally understood.

The Dao awakens to true delight,
Wisdom spans ten thousand ages.
Naturally pure, resolve steadfast,
Nature and life radiant, whole, depart.

Daily life binds the maddened ape,
Empty the heart—subtle truth conveyed.
The true Dao-eye pried open,
Pure intent beholds the numinous immortals.

Gentle, the spirit and qi refined,
Turbid evil—nature’s darkness.
Awakened, one transcends birth and death,
Truly returns beyond heaven’s path.

Good and pure, death escaped,
Heaven gleams with ten thousand lights.
True penetration, perfect subtle principle,
Departing, one treads clouds in flight.

Right principle obscures others’ faults,
The Dao ascends the Milky Way’s ladder.
Responsive to conditions, unobstructed,
Deeds complete, conduct without lack.

Beauty’s illusion—bone perceived,
Knowing emptiness, intent does not linger.
Suddenly life’s nature vast,
Truly enlightened, one roams grotto-heavens.

Reaching shore, birth extinguished,
Vital harmony—Dao-nature’s spirit.
Life abides, completion perfected,
Serene, merit and deeds fulfilled.

Good awakening scorns empty strife,
Forgetting dust, the Dao’s work seen.
Subtly linked to the Three Treasures,
Golden light pierces jade peaks.

The wheel of birth and death vast,
Preserve life, forget worldly love.
Clouds and waters companion pine peaks,
Wisdom’s spirit observes freedom.

No-self, subtle light awakened,
The Dao attained—free from the shell’s trade.
Principle bright, perfect virtue whole,
The numinous image grasped from the void.

Daily, the six senses pure,
Awakened to truth, principle clear.
Naturally all deeds complete,
Departing, one soars azure skies.

Others’ faults seem one’s own past,
Humble, truly the bright self known.
Descending fire refines gold and lead,
Deeds complete—the fruit of non-action.

Things exhausted, the Dao’s constancy,
Serene, perfect virtue endures.
Forgetting words, subtle principle bright,
Life abides—elixir’s light congealed.

Virtue whole, love and hate ended,
Heaven’s Dao—hard to inquire.
Awakened, naturally penetrated,
Yang pure—the cloud-path near.

Guard the Dao, truly without fault,
Lost, awakening is easy.
Heaven azure, ten thousand forms bright,
Ascending immortals escape the lower ghosts.

Through myriad myriad cycles turned,
Seeing the Dao, death and life escaped.
Beyond yin-yang’s shell,
Vital harmony meets the parted stream.

Great awakening scorns empty strife,
Utmost clarity embraces all things.
Hidden immortals truly weary of filth,
Beyond the grotto, pines for companions.

Pure and true, death and life grasped,
Preserve life—qi and spirit refined.
Deeds penetrate all goodness,
Merit complete, Penglai reached.

Defying the Dao, one treads thin ice,
Love deluded—nature and life sink.
The foolish ape bound and captured,
Accumulated deeds—sages and worthies admire.

The wheel of birth and death vast,
Unenlightened, kindness breeds harm.
Suddenly awakened, grotto-heavens roamed,
Principle bright—Dharma’s sea crossed.

Daily, not a moment astray,
From start to end, resolve steadfast.
Yang pure, spirit’s radiance dazzling,
Flawless, perfectly round.

Non-contention—perfect virtue whole,
The Dao awakened, subtle truth conveyed.
Adapting, truly enlightened,
Shedding form—immortal of Peng Isle.

Seeing the Dao, nature non-contentious,
Vital harmony—ten thousand wisdoms bright.
Naturally all deeds complete,
Weary of the world, grotto-heavens roamed.

Advancing truth, entering azure void,
Retreating, intent holds Fengdu’s realm.
Neither retreat nor advance,
Roaming mountains, mingling in the world’s abode.

Meeting immortals, truth made bright,
Daily, mercury simmers lead.
Attaining clarity, level conduct,
The Dao’s mystery precedes heaven and earth.

Attained the Dao, scorns empty strife,
Dust merged—multitudes’ filth embraced.
In later years, truly weary of the world,
Beyond the grotto, pines for companions.

Pure and void, resolve must firm,
Beyond the world—good to cultivate immortality.
The Dao escapes the wheel’s suffering,
Truly ascending—ten thousand ages conveyed.

Things exhausted, truly deathless,
Pure and penetrating—Dao-wisdom born.
Naturally all transformations bright,
Forgetting the world, conditions leveled.

Preserve life, through truth blessed,
Heaven’s gate opens wisdom’s eye.
Bright origin, the Dao-treasure whole,
Truly departing—quickly toward the origin.

Numinous peaks transcend the sea of suffering,
Awakened—true enlightenment understood.
Meaning grasped, words forgotten,
The Dao attained beyond heaven and earth.

Knowing the world’s dream illusory,
How many dwell beyond the dust?
Attaining principle, heaven’s Dao bright,
Truly penetrating ancient and modern texts.

Guard the Dao, awakened to perfection,
Naturally wisdom’s eye beholds.
Numinous void—truly imperishable,
Pure and clear—ancient Chang’an.

The Dao awakened transcends birth and death,
Suddenly bright—the profound intent.
Pure resolve from start to end,
The pivot—sages and worthies bestow.

Forgetting greed, sins and ills dispelled,
Attaining principle, nature and life refined.
Hidden with the Dao, pine peaks for companions,
In later years, paying homage to the supreme sage.

Through myriad myriad cycles turned,
Enlightened to the Dao, death and life escaped.
Pure life, whole and flawless,
Transforming, moving through hexagrams’ lines.

Daily, awakened to purity,
Non-contention embraces all things.
True constancy—utmost Dao bright,
Departing, one joins immortals.

Beyond dust, pure resolve firm,
The Dao awakened—nurturing the Three Fields.
Long grown, the numinous sprout perfected,
True light—hemp and wheat conveyed.

Subtle penetration, the Dao-eye opened,
Truly enlightened—Penglai reached.
Beyond things, birth and death transcended,
Eternal spirit—no earthly grave.

Suddenly awakened, joy in the formless,
The pivot—perception and knowledge dissolved.
Heaven azure, ten thousand forms manifest,
Auspicious radiance pierces curtains and screens.

Right principle awakens purity,
Naturally all love and hate ended.
The Dao bright, all deeds complete,
Shedding the shell—true form revealed.

Mindful of the Dao, truly without fault,
New transgressions—no strange deeds wrought.
Pure and penetrating, aligned with sacred scripture,
Preserving life—spirit transcends the other.

Gentle and weak, qi and spirit refined,
Beneath pine peaks one treads.
Enlightened immortals hide in blessed lands,
Attaining principle—deeds and merit complete.

Truly enlightened, pure single intent,
Attained the Dao—birth and death transcended.

---

chunks.original_text: 三宝变纯阳，升仙名达士。 清虚悟性命，去住如对圣。 厌世洞天游，隐真积至行。 女男如父母，正念圣贤许。 真静姹婴欢，道成救七祖。 洞天四面青，云外列围屏。 松峰墦石坐，无事诵仙经。 四假似环庵，翠烟万顷贪。 灵龟随皓鹤，伴我共成三。 常善气清深，冲和无垢侵。 灵珠明道体，结就水中金。 苦形欲念忘，清命免无常。 守道通仙福，真明现宝光。 日用爱憎无，超尘入碧虚。 真常全道德，归去到仙都。 正理悟通经，天青道象明。 意清祥耀灿，照见亘初灵。 坚志不争空，真明万慧通。 养成无价宝，现出亘初容。 妙道微明用，静通光运动。 气神相见灵，意厌浮生梦。 理明达万古，清志真仙举。 蝉蜕兔轮回，云归朝圣主。 万古死生大，古今几个解。 清虚了性命，海变松枯在。 守清神气灵，道理自然明。 万行真平了，语通合圣经。 万物阴阳外，道坚真不坏。 谦清上善归，应变通元海。 饱暖身闲意，苦形降伏易。 命住道通真，阳纯免下鬼。 万劫落轮回，顿明霄汉梯。 命全性耀灿，云步乐希夷。 真通万虑忘，得道免无常。 物外超生死，碧虚现宝光。 道用缚傻猿，形忘真自然。 微通祥耀灿，射透九重天。 正理应方圆，道通真涌泉，阒明全万善，达了行功圆。 抱道通生路，心死命光住。 气神相见灵，至理明千古。 觉了阴阳外，至真明道大。 命清无灭生，厌世升仙界。 清志有始终，明知世爱空。 神舟超彼岸，云步出灵峰。 明我悟谦通，混元虎逐龙。 自然三宝结，真了与仙同。 得道免轮回，灵峰霄汉梯。 洞天修性命，今古几人归。 四假似浮沤，真明月正秋。 人牛都不见，光耀照山头。 限到变骷髅，知空一念休。 命生免下鬼，了道去瀛洲。 出有无生死，达理明真士。 清善始终志，微妙灵中赐。 微通道眼开，觉了见如来。 无生路上去，云步到蓬莱。 云步到微通，照明似烛红。 世华真拂尽，茶味爽灵容。 日用善清通，住行坐卧功。 周天运降火，光照虎随龙。 万愆心断绝，性似中秋月。 保命隐松峰，无事看庄列。 日月顿无常，二轮飞走忙。 傻猿缚得住，真去从丹阳。 道通明性命，意定真清静。 有志免轮回，仙乡咫尺近。 进道死无怕，如蝉脱下假。 都了上青霄，清声宝无价。 顺真无憎爱，万清通法海。 虚明道理解，应缘无挂碍。 心静至真灵，真常道眼明。 自然通万慧，举意合仙经。 垢尽道明真，冲和气养神。 清通为日用，命外更无亲。 正趣觉通明，命清神气灵。 自然全道慧，应有行功成。 大悟不争空，混尘众垢容。 清平全道德，厌世隐灵峰。 念动想骷髅，真明铅汞收。 道成别有体，蜕壳上云头。 谦柔和气清，无浊命光停。 达理全功行，应尘泯爱憎。 顿觉明真我，周天运降火。 烧见黄金体，道证无为果。 世外不争空，身青如万松。 潺湲通似性，道了虎随龙。 居山远是非，今古几人依。 得道无生死，命圆霄汉梯。 迷着似灯蛾，油窝焦烂多。 孤云伴野鹤，自在出娑婆。 至德爱憎无，真平万病除。 了必三宝结，道达物难拘。 擒猿志要坚，意定汞明铅。 生灭轮回免，大罗归去仙。 真清保性命，垢尽如明镜。 照耀自然光，蜕形朝至圣。 心死性光生，忘情觉命停。 道成别有体，真去自然升。 无生泯万愆，尽爱命光圆。
chunks.translated_text:
The Three Treasures transform into pure yang,
Ascended immortals—names of the enlightened.
In clarity and emptiness, life and nature awakened,
Departure and abiding as if before the sacred.

Weary of the world, roaming cave-heavens,
Concealing truth, accumulating perfect conduct.
Women and men like father and mother,
Right mindfulness—sages and worthies approve.

True stillness, joy in the inner alchemy,
The Dao accomplished—seven ancestors saved.
Cave-heavens verdant on all sides,
Beyond clouds, layered screens arise.

Beneath pine peaks, seated on stone,
At ease, reciting immortal scriptures.
The four illusions like a ringed hermitage,
Emerald mists stretch boundless.

Spiritual tortoises follow white cranes,
Accompanying me to form the trinity.
Ever-good, qi deep and pure,
Unsullied harmony—no defilement invades.

The luminous pearl reveals the Dao-body,
Forged as gold within water.
Suffering form and desire forgotten,
Pure life escapes impermanence.

Guarding the Dao, attaining immortal blessings,
True clarity manifests treasured radiance.
In daily use, love and hate absent,
Transcending dust to enter azure emptiness.

True constancy fulfills virtue and power,
Returning to the immortal capital.
Right principle awakens through scripture,
Heaven azure—the Dao’s image bright.

Intent clear, auspicious radiance resplendent,
Illuminating the eternal primordial spirit.
Resolute will contests not emptiness,
True clarity—ten thousand wisdoms flow.

Nurturing the priceless treasure,
Revealing the eternal primordial countenance.
The wondrous Dao subtly manifests,
Stillness and motion—light in harmony.

Qi and spirit meet in numinosity,
Intent weary of floating life’s dream.
Principle bright, spanning all antiquity,
Pure resolve—true immortals ascend.

Like cicadas shedding, escaping the wheel,
Clouds return to pay homage to the sacred lord.
The great matter of life and death through ages,
How few across time have understood?

In clarity and emptiness, life and nature realized,
Seas shift—pines endure.
Guarding purity, spirit and qi refined,
The Dao’s principles naturally clear.

Ten thousand practices truly fulfilled,
Speech aligned with sacred scripture.
Beyond the yin and yang of all things,
The Dao firm—truly indestructible.

Humility and purity, the highest good returns,
Adapting to change, penetrating the primordial sea.
Sated and warm, body at ease,
Suffering form subdued with ease.

Life preserved, the Dao truly pervades,
Pure yang—no descent to ghostly realms.
Through ten thousand kalpas in the wheel,
Sudden clarity ascends the celestial ladder.

Life complete, nature radiant,
Cloud-stepping in the joy of formlessness.
True penetration—forgets ten thousand cares,
Attaining the Dao—escaping impermanence.

Beyond things, transcending life and death,
Azure emptiness reveals treasured light.
The Dao’s work binds the foolish ape,
Form forgotten—true nature revealed.

Subtle penetration, auspicious radiance resplendent,
Piercing the ninefold heavens.
Right principle responds to square and circle,
The Dao flows like a surging spring.

Profound clarity fulfills ten thousand virtues,
Attaining completion in conduct.
Embracing the Dao, the path of life opens,
Heart stilled—life’s light abides.

Qi and spirit meet in numinosity,
Ultimate principle bright through the ages.
Awakened beyond yin and yang,
The utmost truth—greatness of the Dao revealed.

Life pure, no birth or extinction,
Weary of the world—ascending immortal realms.
Pure resolve has beginning and end,
Knowing worldly attachments are empty.

The spirit-boat crosses to the other shore,
Cloud-stepping beyond the numinous peak.
Illuminating my awakening to humility,
Primal chaos—tiger pursues dragon.

Naturally the Three Treasures conjoin,
True realization—one with immortals.
Attaining the Dao—escaping the wheel,
The numinous peak as the celestial ladder.

Cave-heavens cultivate life and nature,
How few through time have returned?
The four illusions like floating bubbles,
True clarity—moon at autumn’s zenith.

Neither ox nor man in sight,
Radiance illuminates the mountain’s crest.
Limit reached—transforming to skull,
Knowing emptiness, a single thought ceases.

Life preserved—no descent to ghosts,
Attaining the Dao—departing for Penglai.
Emerging from being and non-being,
Awakened to principle—true enlightened one.

Pure goodness from beginning to end,
Subtle wonders bestowed within the numinous.
Subtle penetration—Dao-eye opens,
Awakened—seeing the Tathāgata.

On the path of no-birth,
Cloud-stepping to Penglai.
Cloud-stepping to subtle penetration,
Illumination like a candle’s crimson glow.

Worldly splendor truly swept away,
Tea’s savor refreshes the spirit’s visage.
Daily use—goodness clear and flowing,
In dwelling, walking, sitting, lying—practice.

Circulating the heavens, descending fire,
Light follows—tiger pursues dragon.
Ten thousand transgressions severed,
Nature like the mid-autumn moon.

Preserving life, hidden beneath pine peaks,
At ease, reading the *Zhuangzi* and *Liezi*.
Sun and moon suddenly impermanent,
Two wheels hasten in flight.

The foolish ape bound,
Truly departing for Danyang.
The Dao pervades—life and nature bright,
Intent settled—true stillness.

With resolve, escaping the wheel,
The immortal homeland near at hand.
Advancing in the Dao—death holds no fear,
Like a cicada shedding its shell.

All fulfilled, ascending azure skies,
Pure voice—treasure beyond price.
Following truth, no love or hate,
Ten thousand purities flow into the Dharma-sea.

Empty clarity—Dao’s understanding,
Responding to conditions without hindrance.
Heart still—the utmost true numen,
True constancy—Dao-eye bright.

Naturally penetrating ten thousand wisdoms,
Intent aligns with immortal scripture.
Defilements exhausted—Dao bright and true,
Harmonious qi nurtures spirit.

Clarity and penetration as daily use,
Beyond life—no other kin.
Right focus—awakening clear,
Life pure, spirit and qi refined.

Naturally fulfilling Dao-wisdom,
All that should be—conduct complete.
Great awakening contests not emptiness,
Amid dust, all defilements dissolve.

Clarity and peace fulfill virtue and power,
Weary of the world—hidden in numinous peaks.
Thoughts stir—contemplating skulls,
True clarity—lead and mercury gathered.

The Dao accomplished—another body exists,
Shedding the shell, ascending cloud-tops.
Humility, gentleness, qi pure,
No turbidity—life’s light abides.

Attaining principle, conduct complete,
Responding to dust—love and hate dissolved.
Sudden awakening—true self revealed,
Circulating the heavens, descending fire.

Burning reveals the golden body,
The Dao verifies the fruit of non-action.
Beyond the world, contests not emptiness,
Body verdant as ten thousand pines.

Flowing like nature’s essence,
The Dao realized—tiger pursues dragon.
Dwelling in mountains, far from strife,
How few through time have relied upon this?

Attaining the Dao—no life or death,
Life complete—the celestial ladder.
Deluded attachments like moths to flame,
Oil consumed—charred and ruined.

Solitary clouds companion wild cranes,
At ease, departing Saṃsāra.
Utmost virtue—love and hate absent,
True peace—ten thousand ills cured.

Certainty—Three Treasures conjoin,
The Dao attained—things cannot constrain.
Capturing the ape—resolve must be firm,
Intent settled—mercury bright, lead gathered.

Birth and death, the wheel escaped,
Great Purity—returning as immortal.
True purity preserves life and nature,
Defilements exhausted like a mirror’s sheen.

Radiance naturally shines,
Shedding form to pay homage to the utmost sage.
Heart stilled—nature’s light born,
Emotions forgotten—awareness of life ceases.

The Dao accomplished—another body exists,
Truly departing—naturally ascending.
No-birth dissolves ten thousand transgressions,
All attachments—life’s light complete.

chunks.original_text: 柔弱气神定，真通道德全。 去除物我心，日用理幽深。 觉了真明达，阳纯神鬼钦。 觉悟不争空，他非应变容。 自然全福行，真了到蟾官。 物尽道光生，天青宝鉴明。 命清圆弗缺，应变自然灵。 贩骨死生大，了真通世外，道成别有体，海变松枯在。 守真觉道安，达理悟双关。 微妙通颠倒，垂光炼大丹。 出家不管家，混俗心无俗。 动静两俱忘，道通消三毒。 气降至神灵，忘情觉命清。 自然三宝结，达理行功成。 修行搜已过，意定胜打坐。 世外伴松峰，志坚成道果。 无争全上士，抱道凭清志。 动静两忘常，了真无老死。 苦形浊念无，世梦转头虚。 清静调婴姹，云归蓬岛居。 通善气神和，去憎道行多。 慧灵天地外，万伪弗能过。 达道自然明，清平功行盈。 贪争心意尽，养就气精神。 贩骨死生大，忘尘通世外。 命清宝鉴圆，抱道真光在。 交钱收领契，依理成交易。 未足写文会，代余便去税。 大悟不争我，德全无上果。 周天十二通，丹结运真火。 超尘远生死，性定自然灵。 命住光无缺，理通应变明。 道明真悟坚，空色两俱捐。 达了忘尘虑，人间自在仙。 爱者却如冤，人间第一贤。 许庞拔宅去，鸡犬从升天。 大悟性无争，冲和觉慧明。 命清阳耀灿，应变自然平。 厌浊洞天居，了真达古书。 清通全万慧，云水乐无余。 无我觉真明，冲和神气灵。 自然金耀灿，道达出阳阴。 迷阴蛾恋灯，就死入油烹。 形似丹霄鹤，蓬莱云路行。 身若草头珠，顿明世伪虚。 万年松桧下，闲看古贤书。 真明道眼开，清意性无灾。 趖了无边业，超升去弗来。 形病真无病，修行清保命。 道成身外身，真了朝仙圣。 天莹千光悬，心清见本真。 宝光圆不缺，命住两全成。 道全性命大，至理深如海。 顿明物我忘，古今几个解。 应尘似水平，达道意无憎。 养就真三宝，云归朝上清。 善光明道禧，世外乐希夷。 达理通天行，了真霄汉梯。 蛾灯爱是痴，清命月无亏。 下鬼上仙路，升沉悟与迷。 修真要坚志，学道终如始。 虚空贤圣知，性命超生死。 混世隐名山，俱忘动静安。 真常性弗变，跳出死生关。 身闲杂念多，迷伪恋灯蛾。 早悟云边鹤，飞升入大罗。 念道真无病，住行如对圣。 清平至德全，蜕壳光无映。 大道本无修，随缘莫外求。 命全无价宝，真去列仙俦。 正理离中边，性如出水莲。 碧天云散尽，秋夜宝光圆。 忘尘觉性明，悟理洽仙经。 命耀圆无缺，自然远死生。 常善缚心猿，真通结汞铅。 道成别有体，蜕壳去升仙。 敬道了真修，无欢意没愁。 筠轩看古教，达理行功周。 趖免恩生害，顿明性命大。 黍珠光运转，海变松枯在。 悟道不争空，真明万伪容。 自然全上善，应变行功通。 美貌想骷髅，善清铅汞修。 道全真弗朽，归去上云头。 知空清志坚，爱者却如冤。 蛾恋灯光死，云闲鹤遇仙。 俗念我人无，真通性不愚。 养成全玉体，换了这形躯。 大见悟无争，冲和神气灵。 清平全至德，真去似飞星。 谦清至德归，云水任东西。 道性明枢要，自然结坎离。 苦体色心消，闹中悟寂寥。 真常忘动静，归去上丹霄。 清真脱死生，缚住傻猿宁。 气结神灵达，了归云路行。 得一真明大，道全通世外。 人间混俗尘，挂碍无挂碍。 道兔死生危，了真霄汉梯。
chunks.translated_text:
Softness and weakness settle qi and spirit,
True penetration completes Dao and virtue.
Removing the heart of self and things,
Daily practice delves into profound principle.

Awakened—true clarity attained,
Yang pure—spirits and ghosts revere.
Realized—emptiness is not contended,
Others’ faults adapt in form.

Naturally, blessed conduct is whole,
Truly awakened—arriving at the Moon Palace.
Things exhausted—Dao’s radiance arises,
Heaven’s azure, the jeweled mirror bright.

Life’s purity—round and unbroken,
Adapting naturally—spiritually efficacious.
The great matter of life and death transcended,
Truly awakened—beyond the world’s bounds.

Dao accomplished—another body exists,
Seas shift, pines endure.
Guarding truth—awakened Dao at peace,
Comprehending principle—dual gates unlocked.

Subtle wonders penetrate inversion,
Radiance descends—refining the Great Elixir.
Leaving home—yet home unheeded,
Blending with the world—heart without worldliness.

Movement and stillness both forgotten,
Dao’s flow dissolves the Three Poisons.
Qi descends—spirit numinous,
Emotions forgotten—life’s clarity dawns.

Naturally, the Three Treasures conjoin,
Comprehending principle—cultivation perfected.
Refining conduct—searching one’s faults,
Intent settled—surpassing seated meditation.

Beyond the world—pine peaks as companions,
Resolve firm—Dao’s fruit attained.
Uncontending—perfecting the superior person,
Embracing the Dao—relying on pure resolve.

Movement and stillness both forgotten always,
Truly awakened—no aging, no death.
Suffering form—impure thoughts absent,
Worldly dreams—turning back, all is void.

Purity and stillness harmonize infant and maiden,
Clouds return—dwelling on Peng Isle.
Permeating goodness—qi and spirit harmonized,
Dispelling hatred—Dao’s conduct flourishes.

Wisdom’s numinosity—beyond heaven and earth,
Ten thousand falsities cannot surpass.
Attaining the Dao—naturally luminous,
Purity and peace—meritorious deeds full.

Greed and contention—heart’s intent exhausted,
Nurtured—qi and spirit refined.
The great matter of life and death transcended,
Dust forgotten—beyond the world’s bounds.

Life’s purity—jeweled mirror round,
Embracing the Dao—true radiance abides.
Exchanging coins—receiving the deed,
Following principle—transaction complete.

Insufficient to record the covenant,
Substituting for me—conveniently paying taxes.
Great awakening—self not contended,
Virtue whole—supreme fruit attained.

Twelve meridians of the celestial cycle unobstructed,
Elixir congealed—true fire circulated.
Transcending dust—far from life and death,
Nature settled—naturally efficacious.

Life abides—radiance unbroken,
Principle penetrated—adaptation clear.
Dao’s clarity—true realization firm,
Form and emptiness both relinquished.

Attained—worldly cares forgotten,
In the human realm—at ease as immortal.
Lovers become like foes,
In the world—the foremost worthy.

Xu and Pang—entire households departed,
Chickens and dogs ascended to heaven.
Great awakening—nature uncontending,
Balanced harmony—awareness and wisdom bright.

Life’s purity—yang’s brilliance resplendent,
Adaptation—naturally level.
Weary of turbidity—dwelling in grotto-heavens,
Truly awakened—ancient texts comprehended.

Purity and penetration—all wisdom complete,
Clouds and waters—joy without end.
Selfless—true clarity luminous,
Balanced harmony—spirit and qi numinous.

Naturally, golden radiance resplendent,
Dao attained—beyond yin and yang.
Deluded—moths enamored of lamps,
Drawn to death—plunged into boiling oil.

Form like a crane in the cinnabar clouds,
Journeying the cloud paths of Penglai.
Body like a dewdrop on grass,
Suddenly enlightened—world’s falsity void.

Beneath thousand-year pines and cypresses,
Leisurely perusing ancient sages’ texts.
True clarity—Dao’s eye opened,
Pure intent—nature without calamity.

Escaping boundless karma,
Ascending—departing, never to return.
Form’s illness—truly no illness,
Cultivating—purely preserving life.

Dao accomplished—body beyond body,
Truly awakened—paying homage to immortals and sages.
Heaven’s luster—thousand lights suspended,
Heart pure—original true nature seen.

Jeweled radiance—round and unbroken,
Life abiding—both wholly perfected.
Dao whole—nature and life great,
Utmost principle—deep as the sea.

Suddenly enlightened—self and things forgotten,
From ancient times to now—how many comprehend?
Responding to dust—like water’s level,
Attaining the Dao—intent without hatred.

Nurtured—the true Three Treasures,
Clouds return—paying homage to Supreme Purity.
Goodness’ radiance—Dao’s felicity,
Beyond the world—joy in the formless.

Comprehending principle—celestial conduct unobstructed,
Truly awakened—ladder to the Milky Way.
Moths’ love for lamps—deluded folly,
Pure life—moon without waning.

Lower paths—ghosts; upper paths—immortals,
Ascending or sinking—awakening or delusion.
Cultivating truth—resolve must be firm,
Learning the Dao—beginning as at the end.

Void and space—sages and worthies know,
Nature and life—transcending life and death.
Blending with the world—hidden in famous mountains,
Both movement and stillness forgotten—at peace.

True constancy—nature unchanging,
Leaping beyond the gate of life and death.

chunks.original_text: 命光如皓月，爱泯永无亏。 卦尽休争我，功圆成道果。 天青万象明，照见元初个。 他非如自过，意定胜身坐。 不着有形物，无愆成道果。 正理解清平，自然明大成。 忘情全命耀，道养气神灵。 常善运真火，灵通觉无我。 广明万慧应，性似青莲朵。 清平妙进明，顿觉气神灵。 达理中边弃，自然入大成。 真通万事容，清志碧虚中。 汞结神光灿，道全了行功。 无争道性强，保命浊情忘。 永免轮回苦，真归蓬岛乡。 善通觉有明，道阐乐真荣。 厌世松峰畔，功成朝玉清。 动静两俱忘，自然觉性常。 汞铅成大药，真了到仙乡。 清善存三一，擒猿意不出。 真明应变通，福地去游历。 对景省灯蛾，志坚出爱河。 松峰霞洞隐，得一行功多。 德平万垢容，清命与仙同。 达理真无变，蓬莱云路通。 善清争性命，觉了傻猿定。 天动气冲和，阳纯朝至圣。 通善灭无明，忘贪有甚争。 天条心不犯，归真道光升。 无我气神清，命圆大道成。 知明万慧达，真去住蓬瀛。 忘情觉命坚，达理性明贤。 气顺珠光灿，功成蓬岛仙。 无我气神灵，忘情命耀成。 始终真在道，归去到蓬瀛。 志坚明性命，妄尽心猿定。 妙觉气冲和，道成朝至圣。 道明出死生，真养气神精。 达理通灵慧，自然应变平。 念道消三毒，清心忘六欲。 志坚全性命，知足通清福。 轮回五道转，不造万愆免。 趖业乐清虚，保命真修炼。 苦形忘爱念，命住修真验。 守道有终始，阴消因慧剑。 通经明正理，道觉真无比。 混世却无心，升仙免下鬼。 休苦化人钱，结缘任自然。 不贪清福广，守道意无愆。 虚心包大藏，达理涌泉通。 三教无分别，修真第一功。 无情命耀圆，无垢性光圆。 无恶黍珠灿，无憎功行圆。 灯蛾迷爱光，远色兔无常。 仙伴孤云鹤，命清得道阳。 通善灭无明，道全神气灵。 命光成补缺，碧耀晃虚清。 臭烂变骷髅，迷阴堕马牛。 清真全性命，蓬壶阆苑游。 通善行清深，自然火炼金。 功成真厌世，福地伪难侵。 守真坚志了，常善通微妙。 气绝命光圆，古今明者少。 无争善气清，光照似飞星。 混合形神异，碧霄云外行。 先天乃道初，生死物难拘。 清命圆光莹，阳纯蓬岛居。 垢尽晃空虚，真明弃有无。 定光通万慧，达了古今书。 性光命似油，忘爱了真修。 世恋骷髅梦，千生卧土丘。 蛾恋灯光死，鹤寻云路生。 两般由自己，天莹万辉明。 顿明厌世空，高卧白云中。 养就真铅汞，超升出宝峰。 定光得志宁，觉了亘灵明。 达理全功行，命圆脱死生。 德全尽爱憎，去浊寸灵明。 养就真铅汞，蜕形朝上清。 仙乐集卷之五竟
chunks.translated_text:
Life’s radiance—like the bright moon,
Love extinguished—never waning.

Hexagrams exhausted—cease contending self,
Merit perfected—Dao’s fruit attained.
Heaven’s azure—myriad forms illuminated,
Illumining the primordial singularity.
Others’ faults—like one’s own transgressions,
Mind settled—body seated in victory.
Not clinging to form-bound things,
Faultless—Dao’s fruit achieved.

Right understanding—pure and balanced,
Naturally—great clarity attained.
Emotions forgotten—life’s radiance complete,
Dao nurtures—qi and spirit numinous.
Ever skillfully wielding true fire,
Spiritually attuned—awakening to no-self.
Vastly illuminating—myriad wisdoms respond,
Nature—like the blue lotus blossom.

Pure and balanced—subtly advancing clarity,
Suddenly perceiving—qi and spirit numinous.
Comprehending principle—discarding center and periphery,
Naturally—entering great accomplishment.
Truly penetrating—all matters embraced,
Pure resolve—within azure emptiness.
Mercury congeals—spirit’s light resplendent,
Dao perfected—merit’s work complete.

Uncontentious—Dao-nature strong,
Preserving life—forgetting turbid passions.
Forever freed from the suffering of rebirth,
Truly returning—to Penglai’s isle.
Skillfully penetrating—awareness luminous,
Dao expounded—joy in true glory.
Weary of the world—beside pine peaks,
Merit perfected—paying homage to Jade Purity.

Movement and stillness—both forgotten,
Naturally—awakened nature constant.
Mercury and lead—become the great elixir,
Truly awakened—arriving at immortals’ realm.
Pure goodness—abiding in the Three Ones,
Taming the monkey-mind—intent not straying.
True clarity—adapting to all changes,
Fortunate lands—roaming freely.

Confronting scenes—reflecting on moths and lamps,
Resolve firm—emerging from the river of love.
Pine peaks—hidden in rosy clouds’ caves,
Attaining the One—merit’s work abundant.
Virtue balanced—myriad stains embraced,
Pure life—equal to immortals.
Comprehending principle—truly unchanging,
Penglai’s cloud-paths—open and clear.

Skillfully refining—nature and life,
Awakened—deluded monkey-mind stilled.
Heaven moves—qi harmonious and balanced,
Yang pure—paying homage to the Supreme Sage.
Penetrating goodness—extinguishing ignorance,
Forgetting greed—what contention remains?
Heaven’s precepts—heart untransgressed,
Returning to truth—Dao’s light ascends.

No-self—qi and spirit pure,
Life perfected—great Dao accomplished.
Wisdom bright—myriad wisdoms attained,
Truly departing—dwelling in Pengying.
Emotions forgotten—life’s resolve firm,
Comprehending principle—nature luminous and wise.
Qi flowing—pearl’s light resplendent,
Merit perfected—Penglai’s immortal.

No-self—qi and spirit numinous,
Emotions forgotten—life’s radiance complete.
From beginning to end—truly abiding in Dao,
Returning—arriving at Pengying.
Resolve firm—nature and life illuminated,
Delusions exhausted—monkey-mind stilled.
Subtly awakened—qi harmonious and balanced,
Dao accomplished—paying homage to the Supreme Sage.

Dao bright—transcending life and death,
Truly nurturing—qi and spirit refined.
Comprehending principle—spiritual wisdom penetrating,
Naturally—responding to changes with equanimity.
Reciting Dao—dissolving the Three Poisons,
Purifying the heart—forgetting the Six Desires.
Resolve firm—preserving nature and life,
Contentment—attaining pure blessings.

Rebirth’s five paths—turning endlessly,
Not creating—myriad transgressions avoided.
Escaping karma—delighting in pure emptiness,
Preserving life—truly cultivating refinement.
Suffering form—forgetting love’s attachments,
Life stabilized—verifying true cultivation.
Guarding Dao—from beginning to end,
Yin dissolved—by wisdom’s sword.

Penetrating scriptures—illuminating right principle,
Dao awakened—truly beyond compare.
Blending with the world—yet without intent,
Ascending as immortals—avoiding lower ghosts.
Ceasing suffering—transforming others’ wealth,
Forming affinities—letting nature take its course.
Not coveting—pure blessings vast,
Guarding Dao—intent without fault.

Empty heart—embracing the great treasury,
Comprehending principle—welling spring flowing.
Three teachings—without distinction,
Cultivating truth—paramount endeavor.
No passions—life’s radiance perfected,
No stains—nature’s light complete.
No evil—millet-pearl resplendent,
No hatred—merit’s work accomplished.

Moths—deluded by love’s light,
Avoiding form—escaping impermanence.
Immortal companions—solitary cloud-cranes,
Life pure—attaining Dao’s yang.
Penetrating goodness—extinguishing ignorance,
Dao perfected—spirit and qi numinous.
Life’s light—mending deficiencies,
Azure radiance—shimmering in empty clarity.

Rot and decay—transforming into skulls,
Deluded by yin—falling as horses and oxen.
Pure and true—preserving nature and life,
Roaming Penglai’s and Langyuan’s gardens.
Penetrating goodness—practicing purity deeply,
Naturally—fire refining gold.
Merit perfected—truly weary of the world,
Fortunate lands—falsehoods unable to invade.

Guarding truth—resolve firm and awakened,
Ever skillfully—penetrating the subtle.
Qi severed—life’s radiance perfected,
From ancient times to now—few are enlightened.
Uncontentious—good qi pure,
Light shining—like a shooting star.
Blending—form and spirit distinct,
Beyond azure clouds—journeying afar.

Prior Heaven—Dao’s beginning,
Life and death—things cannot restrain.
Pure life—radiant light complete,
Yang pure—dwelling on Penglai’s isle.
Stains exhausted—shimmering in empty void,
True clarity—discarding being and non-being.
Steadfast light—penetrating myriad wisdoms,
Comprehending—ancient and modern texts.

Nature’s light—life like oil,
Forgetting love—truly cultivating refinement.
Worldly attachments—skulls’ dreams,
A thousand lives—reclining in earthen mounds.
Moths—dying for lamp’s light,
Cranes—seeking cloud-paths to life.
Both fates—by one’s own hand,
Heaven’s radiance—myriad glories bright.

Suddenly awakened—weary of worldly emptiness,
Reclining high—amidst white clouds.
Nurturing true lead and mercury,
Transcending—ascending beyond jeweled peaks.
Steadfast light—attaining resolve’s tranquility,
Awakened—eternally luminous and clear.
Comprehending principle—merit’s work complete,
Life perfected—liberated from life and death.

Virtue perfected—exhausting love and hatred,
Discarding turbidity—inch of spirit luminous.
Nurturing true lead and mercury,
Shedding form—paying homage to Supreme Purity.
Immortal joys—*Scroll Five* concluded.

love for lamps—deluded folly,
Pure life—moon without waning.

Lower paths—ghosts; upper paths—immortals,
Ascending or sinking—awakening or delusion.
Cultivating truth—resolve must be firm,
Learning the Dao—beginning as at the end.

Void and space—sages and worthies know,
Nature and life—transcending life and death.
Blending with the world—hidden in famous mountains,
Both movement and stillness forgotten—at peace.

True constancy—nature unchanging,
Leaping beyond the gate of life and death.
